y2fe1gTzqKZghTpVa8lSOw.text: Good place for quick bite, it's a local stop for the neighborhood folks. Fair prices, good food, nice beer selections. Casual and plenty of seating. Great place to watch the games and plenty of TVs all over to check scores.

TsnSf-ofHD9H_UHlIsv0TQ.text: The service is amazing here, I've never had a bad experience. Monday, Wednesday  and Friday nights are amazing. Monday's they have all you can eat boneless wings, Wednesday's they have $3 craft beers and Fridays they have $5 margaritas and $4 Captain Morgan's. Tiffanie is amazing, she always has a smile on her face and is very knowledgeable with the beers on tap.

EP0e76ardm_otMJ7RAegQQ.text: Fantastic 100% fresh take on food. Even the simple items explode with flavor when freshly made.  Great staff. Owner always on site and part of the daily operations.  Food has great value.    I love this place.   It is now a favorite.  They have a loyalty card that will lead to a free lunch in no time.  Simple!

U5UTqnXDD6z5hJeOK22xSQ.text: I've been coming here for years.  This is the best craft beer bar in Arizona.  Draft beer selection is fantastic and changes almost hourly.  They have big glasses of Riesling wine (for the girlfriend) at a good price.  Staff is motivated, friendly, and fast.  The boneless grilled chicken wings with the crazy-hot sauce (mix of BBQ and spicy) are great.  The gyro quesadilla with green tortilla (on-request) is excellent.  The specials created by Gidi are always the best choice. This place needs a pizza oven and a second patio without any people smoking -- and it would be perfect!

oKOgnQ2EaBC-ih4XOEi7FA.text: While we don't come too often, it's our trusted dinner spot- we have a general rule not to do the same restaurant twice, so that we keep getting new experiences, but the Hungry Monk gets a free pass at least once a month- it's solid food you can trust will taste great. If you only got to try one item- I would vote for their fresh, never frozen chicken tenders- they put all other restaurants to shame- I personally love them better than the chicken wings because they are meatier, juicier and over all  a better price for the product.  But of course, don't bother with wings or tenders if you're not up for the house blue cheese dressing- we're truly waiting for them to package it for sale separately- it's that good.  If you get to try a second item- please don't pass up on the gyro quesadilla.  It's SPECTACTULAR- the gyro lamb meat is tender and plentiful, combined with cheese, diced tomatoes and diced onion (I occasionally omit the onions) with a house made tzaziki sauce (I'm sure I butchered the spelling of that, sorry)- it's the genius combination of a delicious gyro with gooey cheese and tortilla.

PxUA2Ed9clzL8vlDuTO6lg.text: We like to come here every so often to catch a game, some beers, and a relaxed environment. The beer selection is the best in town, and if you time it right, you can catch a good special and a bargain. The bartenders make you feel at home. Don't miss their breakfast if you have a chance! I have really grown to love Monk's!

9jMEak8K6TEOp4_lktPsew.text: Probably my second favorite place in the valley after OHSO.  Awesome selection, decent food, service can be a little slow occasionally but still 5 stars.  I hear they have good breakfast during football games, but have yet to try it.

s4chcQyKDUA5Zld-_tD49A.text: Really, really awesome beer selection.  I got to try some stuff I've never had before and I was also pleased to see that they had plenty of offerings from local favorites San Tan and Four Peaks.  My favorite of the night was the Scorpion Amber from Mudshark Brewing  Co. in Lake Havasu City, AZ.  Who knew that there was a brewery in Lake Havasu?  I'll have to try and find that beer again some time.  The food was just OK, though.  Our table tried the edamame which came with an amazing sweet chili sauce but were horribly overcooked, the wings which were cooked well but not spicy enough, the street tacos which were tasty but not even close to being authentic, and the sweet potato fries.  The fries were the biggest disappointment since I usually love those so much.  These, however, seemed to lack flavor.  They weren't overly greasy but somehow all I could taste was the oil they were cooked in.  Our server was fantastic and everyone else working there seemed competent and friendly, too.  The cook even came out to say hello and see how we liked the food (this was prior to the fries so we said we liked it fine).  They seem to have a lot of regulars so I think we stood out as newbies.  But even the fellow customers we met at the community table were friendly.  Overall, a very pleasurable experience.  I am not really a big sports bar person but if when I do have occasion to visit on this will be my top choice of the options close to home.

Ft1vOXZaWrWubtP9NwMyYA.text: Cool neighborhood bar.  Pretty good prices and food for bar food.  Haven't tried a whole lot yet, but I'll be back.

zRpGTI0c1N4TpG9dSNKxiw.text: One of my favorite places in Chandler to grab a bite to eat and have some good craft brews. One of the best items in the menu is their fish n chips. Phenomenal! Only downside is that sometimes they're beer selection is a little too partial on IPAs. I do like IPAs but it would be nice if they carried a little more variety.

lK01bxFM1bcXGXnUqSCBjw.text: Very good beer selection with the most regular offerings from Bells of any local bar I've been to.  Two Hearted is almost always on tap.  Very reasonable prices.  The food is mediocre.  I think they've been trying to step up the food lately but I haven't had anything that was noteworthy.   It can get very crowded and noisy.  If it's not technically a sports bar, it can pass for one.  There are TVs EVERYWHERE, which is a bit of a turn off for me.

Gqcz5_2e-9oKMM4JAz2lCw.text: I met my boss and another business partner here for lunch. It was the business partner's choice, as he called it his "local watering hole" for the service, food and beer selection. Thanks King James Swann! I loved The Hungry Monk, Heather was great and the manager even stopped by to say hello.   This place was pretty busy for lunch and had lots of big TVs so I could see sports scores in between business conversations. I love when a restaurant can draw a good lunch crowd because it lends you to want to come back be a part of the happy hour and night crowd, as well.   They have a lunch menu on the back, so be sure to check it out! I also saw they have board games for customers to play. That's a cool idea!

mQWreEEROALuhIklgiqKyw.text: Stopped in had a San Tan Amber and Wiings.   the wiing sauces were some of the best i've had. the chicken fingers in Teryaki was excellent and  the staff was friendly.  GREAT service, GREAT food.  11 Large screen T.V.s inside for football, 2 outside on patio.  clean place  great selection of craft beers   A+

-f8DusCATiXpF5WHj6A5AQ.text: Mother's Day brunch was awesome.  Staff was fast and friendly. Food was wonderful!! Comfort food from home ~ Homemade biscuits & gravy to the chicken & waffles w/gravy tasty across the board. Prices reasonable!  We will definitely be back!

bufKV2JpAgFJZN8vwiBcAA.text: The food is always good. It is loud inside, so if your looking to talk, it might not be the place for you. The service is ok. I really like the fried fish. I would definitely recommend this place.

kdOhDqRgJYbjFaHbl4S2bw.text: Love this place! The draft beer selection is amazing! And they even bring out the different beers in the appropriate glasses. I had one that Was 12 percent alcohol and they brought it out in a beer wine glass.. My next one was a dark dirty old dog ..something like that.. And it came out in a kind of goblet.. The lighter beers come out in regular pilsner beer glasses.

USYeH5s3bU73RnSZ3lc_VA.text: Decent place, decent food. Nothing more. Just a regular sport bar. The humus was bland, the Hungry Monk Tripple was nothing as described, but an average to small sandwich far from being pilled with meat. A bit overpriced for what was offered. Three cheese Quesadilla was nothing to remember also.  The place is enjoyed by the locals, yet nothing I would recommend if traveling and looking for a special place to eat.

pCJ1NBMUHg6VFcMbO2m4mw.text: Good beer but I don't recommend the food and the service was lackluster.   We ordered two beers from the specialty menu- both were served about 10 degrees warmer than they should have been.   The decor is confusing- part sports bar, part inspirational wall art from Ross.  The red pepper hummus appetizer lacked flavor- overall it was bland and a little depressing.   My Mediterranean veggie wrap magically transformed into a chicken wrap before it hit the table. I notified our waitress who fixed the problem but also let the "wrong" food sit on the table while the new food was fired. Once the correct order was brought out she removed the wrong food from the plate but left the side of sweet potato fries- which were not crispy or warm.  The whole experience made me crabby and I'm still hungry for good food. Won't be going back.

DYWcebLlycMjotIokCmtow.text: We will be back! New renovation looks great. Great beer selection. Fried mushrooms and cauliflower were delicious! Server lacked beer knowledge.

lrjPixUFL1og8TC47yD3Og.text: Walked in on Thursday night around 945pm the tables was closed off and not a place for me to sit unless joining people in the middle of the bar. Not my idea why to spend my lunch from work.. Very disappointed!!

WaiiTyGSGTtoQfdiLW-r7Q.text: Service was okay while we were here. Waitress was changed after we got our drinks and we saw her shooting the breeze with the nearby table for the remainder of our visit.  Beer selection was good, although my hubby was disappointed that they did not have Miller Lite on tap. My pear cider beer was delicious (tasted like Sutter Home Moscato wine). The food, on the other hand, was not delicious. Having moved to the area 6 months ago, we hoped to FINALLY find our go-to wing spot. We got wing-in spicy bbq (which were TINY with over-cooked, stale meat) and boneless honey-hot wings. THese were huge strips of white meat chicken and the sauce was tasty. Our table also got the chicken nachos, which were overpriced and had chili with a canned taste. The last item was the gyro plate. YUCK. The strips of meat were tough and extremely thick. I felt like I was eating dog food. To sum it up....beer and boneless wings=good.  Service and menu aside from boneless wings="meh." Go for 50 cent wing Wed.

IzsgESl86OJEoyKen4DlYQ.text: This was the second time we have tried HM, the first time was so-so but they had just opened with the new format which I believe is unfair to judge a restaurant by. This time we were very pleased, attentive, friendly service which did not rush you. Food was very good (I had the pulled pork with bacon and ham on it--no, I'm not a vegetarian in case you were wondering). They are very accommodating on substitutions (I added cheese to my sandwich and got it with the pretzel bun--definitely get the pretzel bun, regardless of what sandwich you purchase). We will be going there this Friday for the fish fry. Excellent selection of beer, and, while there is a sizable bar and lots of televisions, the sound was not overpowering as happens in so many bar/restaurants. I was there with 4 other people and we were all able to enjoy conversations at normal speaking levels.

bjTjhnXoMaT7LIcV4E-csg.text: Went for a Saturday lunch. The service was great. The beer flight was superb and the food was delicious. We will be going back again and we live in Mesa. It's worth the drive

rAOz6OqFSFlDWpuCzag5xA.text: We've been to the Hungry Monk a few times and always have a good experience.  This visit was no different.  Our server Lauren was great.  She was attentive and prompt and got our order completely right.  She answered all questions and was quite friendly, which I personally appreciate.  The restaurant is clean and well organized.  Nice all the way around.

EGUjTGClEIytNADxD_61Ig.text: Horrible, all you can eat fish came out cold and dark brown. Looked like it was precooked. Waitress said sorry, we can redip that for you. I thought she was kidding. No joke. Fish came back out drenched in grease. Grease All over the plate. Bartender apologized and comped fish. Wonder what's acceptable in the walk-in? Never go there again. Week before, it was phenomenal. Told my wife this was our new go to. Don't go there. Former executive chef and Scottsdale Le Cordon Bleu graduate.

3HNrMJvXPtnR4u8wwVXWNA.text: This place has great food and a fun atmosphere. It can be very loud when busy. We like that it serves craft beer and domestics. Prices are reasonable. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because we have had varying quality of service. We walked out last night after sitting at our table for 10 minutes and not even being acknowledged. Since my boyfriend is diabetic, he needed at least a soda and ended up having a scary low blood sugar by the time we got someplace else. Granted they were slammed, but we were in there another time when it was dead and almost left for the same reason. The server caught us that time and we had a better experience.   Overall, it's a great place and a place we frequent.

E0nDF4Sj7fsglcGsL7TzQA.text: Overall good experience. They had many wing flavors, and let you mix and match. So we played around and we all got a few different flavors. It seemed many were just two mixed together. But that's okay. I even tried these Thai Peanut (upped it to spicy as heck), and they were interesting.  The beers on tap are numerous, she let us taste a few that we hadn't had before and to be honest, the bartender really was doing a good job despite the football crowd. I believe this is a Detroit Lions bar. So there were four guys crying over their loss while we were there. That's all the fans that were there. The bill was very fair and I would go back, but not for the wings in particular, more for the price and the good energy.

DGLTnWu7C7XPQLNMfUqvLg.text: Is there a better place in Chandler to grab a craft beer and some tasty pub grub?  If you say yes, we may have to arm wrestle to determine who is right (hint, it's me). Chef Gidi's daily specials are sure to please a discerning pallet and the beers flow voluminously here.  Tuesday's are Team Trivia at 7pm - yet another reason to drink on a weekday (as if I needed a reason)

6V4HRYtSBZLrqkvkVDNK8w.text: Came here with friends for boneless wings Wednesday night. Packed house which shows it's popular. High volume, lots of energy and great food. Got original, garlic parmesan, and thai peanut wings to change it up. Loved the food but couldn't hear over the noise of the crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Original, garlic parmesan and thai peanut boneless wings

xQQXy9sMoWRJm-0bXhp_6g.text: Shoulda taken a picture of my burger.... It was that amazing that I couldn't! Tater-tots, beer-cheese, bacon cheeseburger and a bud light!!!! Oh yeah, deeeelish... Can't beat that, place is amazing..

d8K_NIEdb7TH9sGejOwZKQ.text: my boyfriend went there tonight for the $0.99 special on their grill chicken tenders . you know how you crave something all day and finally your going to get it???  Just when he was about to dig in there is a 4 - 5 inch long hair draped over his tenders. He takes the initiative to not bring attention to himself and even asked to speak to the manager on the side and not at this table. The manager who was trying to avoid talking to a customer and who had long hair says what do you want me to do about it?  Then in a very nonchalant way says it it must have happened on the way to the table. mentions how he's been in the business for over 20 years. Then I asked if you have been in the business for 20 years why do you not know what you're supposed to do. why don't you ask do you want me to replace that for you and hey let's make your beer and a meal on me . I don't know about you but I'm so tired of people thinking their doing you a favor by  you eating in their restaurant.   Its called customer service and if you want to keep your business open then you treat your customers right how about that?   maybe I'm mad because I was just about to go in there and get my own chicken tenders but more so because you could do better long hair  manager

AysPnEoQy2nBiNW0fA-7dQ.text: Went here for the first time last night. We went mainly for beer selection. This was a good selection. Food was ok nothing great but not bad either. I'd give it 3.5 stars. We will come again

_rloAKXc08t0vaYdUzRpKQ.text: I've been to this establishment several times but my last trip resulted in a trip to the ER and a day missed from work. I ordered the fish n chips it was ok until an hour later. Spent three days violently ill with Viral gastroenteritis.

qmID9nJyVUE5qRcAnbSSPA.text: First time here and was a big let down. The food was decent and the mixed drink was good but there were some problems arising from laziness or lack of attention.   The server seemed to need some adderall because every time some food was brought out something was missing. Took three tries for her to bring out some ranch for our fries.   The food was good but the fried jalapenos were almost in one ball leaving a chunk of batter. The gyros were nice but the one that supposedly had 50% more meat had the same as the regularly priced one.   The atmosphere was basic which would be fine if decent music was playing or just to have some sort of constant music. The station must have been changed at least three times and the volume was messed with every time.   Maybe the workers were still hung over from the night before or just ready to leave to start their weekend but it was a disappointing first trip here. Hopefully if I come around again it will improve.

9Un15gCMCqpEh63374MEcQ.text: This is a great establishment with a wide craft beer selection in the East Valley. I have had food a couple of times, but usually I just go for drinks. Nice large, rotating selection of beers on tap and some good bottles. No carry-out license so if you do get a bigger bottle you have to drink it there.

8Y9cgW-PWzR_zEEN4wE1xQ.text: Great service awsome food. Boneless wings are big and sauces are good. Lots of tv's for sports good environment

9fpTXjS5E28kczHVJnvY3g.text: This is my favorite local bar, service is awesome and the wings are really good with a huge selection of sauces. Great selection of revolving microbrews also. In addition it is aGood place for watching sports

9t0z6lU8TFEl5oUtHrNK9Q.text: Sent my co-worker to grab us lunch and he recommended this place. I ordered the shrimp an rice bowl to go. When he delivered you lunch, I opened the box to see six small pieces of shrimp an the rest all rice! So I called to speak to the manager named Jimmy Tucker, I told him politely an asked if a shrimp an rice bowl only has six small pieces of shrimp an that this was my first time ordering it from there. He agreed an said that's standard an that his store an was not able to help me out with it. Talk about good customer service. The bowl is not worth $9 ladies an gentleman, Jimmy could of handled the situation a lot better. I will never buy anything from this place again.

tqKj1cyPSasfMKbzTcICmg.text: Pros: service is always stellar, great draft lists, Tuesday & Saturday Trivia nights, good atmosphere   Cons: the food   Not sure how this place gets good food reviews but everything I have had there has been pretty "meh". Not somewhere I would ever plan on eating dinner at.   Great for good drinks (craft beer especially) with friends.

RVvJ0qUCScQYSx2ndMOHcw.text: Pretty good bar and bar food, a really nice place in the neighborhood for a late night stop. The bartenders are always amazing and great at making you feel welcome!

9oPVcLfqU4hVLgP_mM_8Jg.text: Good food, wide variety, efficient service, and friendly to all kinds: meat eaters, vegetarians, beer drinkers...

orWMTT37mmzkNXYq-GkuvA.text: Loved their exotic appetizers. Fried mushrooms, fried pickles, spicy cauliflowers. Their beer menu and ambiance is great highly suggested!

AZCZyAvxvThXbwVxFthbiA.text: Stopped in to sample the beers only, and not the food.  Decent little place including a small outdoor patio.m it was a nice evening so we took a seat on the patio.  Their beer selection was pretty large and had a good selection of local and other microbrews.  Ordered a couple beers and enjoyed the weather.  Our server was nice enough, but not super attentive.  The atmosphere was just okay.  Basically a good spot to grab a couple quality beers, but besides the beer selection, it was simply okay.

sRie4nygmlFPcOEHQkkLeQ.text: Pretty quiet on a Saturday night. The beer selection was pretty decent, and their prices were okay. The service was pretty slow considering there was no one there. Maybe we went on an off night?

YiIAXI0hVXlYK7fetkaCUg.text: Great beer selection for beer enthusiasts, but they're always out of everything we wanted to try. Great wings and they have $0.49 boneless wings on Wednesdays. Went on a weekend night and they had karaoke but they played only slow, sappy songs. The "rings" int he name isn't about onion rings, they don't even have those, they're talking about curly fries, which are good but the name is a bit misleading.   Overall, the "meh" with 2 stars is accurate.

dadNEydV2nqck12Mv8oI5w.text: Excellent selection of local and craft beers.    Food is pretty traditional bar fare. The service is hit or miss and the atmosphere is strange: big screen TVs mixed with kitchy country placards on the wall with funny sayings.

joPGr0m2utdNsbWssxkUlA.text: - the location is excellent - the food is mediocre, and milder than they advertise - the wait staff is polite and bland.  At several opportunities, they were missing for more than 5 mins. - the bill will be higher than anyone expects  Bottom line:  don't bother

9LoD4b1k_w6oo6gAe8nddQ.text: The food was great! I went on wing day and the wings were awesome! The Crazy Sauce is BBQ and garlic sauce. It was amazing. The place was pretty dead but they were playing classic rock and ESPN so I was entertained. The service was slow and not overly friendly.

tN-aNZMW1ZzfYPXLv6byaw.text: So we have been here a few times now. The 1st time was good we had the hummus, pita wrap , burger and kids meal. My husbands burger came out well done and he had ordered medium rare.The kids meal was nothing special but they never are(except for the scoop of ice cream).  We went last night and the service was good but 2 people ordered burgers medium rare and they both came out well done even a little burnt. 1 of my children ordered dino chicken nuggets and they were burnt also.  My pita wrap was good and so were the homemade chips. So 2 times we have had burnt burgers.If you can't get burger right when a big portion of your menu is burgers and you send out clearly burnt chicken nuggets(which are frozen from costco), then someone in the kitchen is looking at the food as it is sent out. So I doubt we will be going back.

XJcZ-bWqeDCp7ZbpPnEKYQ.text: I love this place.  If it were up to me it would be the only place I'd ever go to happy hour.  The place has a nice atmosphere and it clean with plenty of TVs around the bar area.  They have a reasonable selection on their menu and the food is fine considering it is mostly bar food and that is all I expect.    To really love this place though, you have to know it is all about the beer.  They have a huge selection, frequently changing it up, and throw special events when they bring in new ones.  I have not found another place that is really into their beers like the Monk and that is reason enough for me to give them my business.

7Typl2ZXhxMf7UP4KQm25g.text: There are a few things on the menu at BWR that pop out, which is why I decided that I needed to go here. On the top of the list of menu stand outs are the buffalo chicken nachos. Just thinking about the potential in that title makes me want them. They are exactly what one would expect that they are - nachos blanketed with cheese and the regular nacho supreme goodness, topped off with a generous helping of diced chicken tenders and buffalo sauce. It's a wonderfully sinful idea, but I felt like it could have been a bit better. I also got to try the gyro quesadilla. Again, this is one crazy sounding concoction that just seemed to fall a little bit short for me. Think of a cheese quesadilla with gyro meat in it served with a side of tzatziki, and there you have it. I will say that their beer selection is pretty fantastic. If I do ever go back here, it'll probably be for a happy hour.

WJwKQIUYBsBRshAvaLVrrQ.text: Some friends and I stopped in and had a couple beers here tonight. They have a really good selection of beer on tap here.  Service was exceptionally good and we had a great time!

rzyDbP7yb-nffCT2mMo8OA.text: I have been to this pub several times and can say the craft beers are very good, friendly management and staff.  Food, well its the norm bar food, what can you say it would not be my choice for dinner out. Great location to meet a few friends and share some drinks and laughs.

e9FzUU76ypQGOwZuBq1Hjw.text: Great beer selection and delcious bar food. I enjoy myself each and every time I visit. There is a reason why many of the craft beer folk head into this place every night and it's not only about the beer. The staff and even the owner is active in engaging with each person that walks in the door.

Ck6kSZro4YDRTCLfPuFlwQ.text: Decided to go here on a whim because they have a clever name.  Turns out that's really all they have going for them, besides the cold beer.  The food was forgettable, the atmosphere was bleh the service was slow and the decor was like a failed attempt at Applebee's.  Needless to say, I won't be going back any time soon.

uheEoD3zFpFdJVi3KOBdTg.text: The place was nice and the beer selection is good.  However, the two dishes that we tried were nothing to write home about.  My husband had the rice bowl and asked for added spice - the kitchen just dumped on a bunch of sriracha and the teriyaki flavor was killed.  I had a gyro - think chunks of meat, but the tzatziki sauce was sour cream based - not yogurt based; and there was very little 'veg' and feta cheese on it.  It isn't all about the meat!  I know I am getting picky for a place that doesn't specialize in these dishes.  But if you put them on the menu, you should be doing them right. I wouldn't go back, truth be told.  There are just too many other places to try out than go back for mediocre food and service.

F2KhXCqIfsg44J8r2xgdfA.text: Hungry Monk bills itself as a family friendly neighborhood restaurant where great food, sports and craft beer collide. And that's exactly what it is.  It feels like "Cheers" to me...definitely a neighborhood hangout where everyone "knows your name."  Whether I stop by for a beer or to watch a Coyotes game, it's a fun place to hangout. Bring friends...or make new ones. It's that inviting.  For me, I like the fact that the employees are super friendly and truly happy to see me walk through the doors. It's a very welcoming place. Service is warm and sincere---and excellent.   They have an eclectic variety of yummy food. Whether I'm hungry for a salad or a plate of fresh wings to accompany my craft beer, the food is really good. I love a good rice bowl--and theirs is dee-lish! The quesadillas are outstanding. Of course, they have typical bar food, or comfort food as I call it, but the quality and taste surpass what I've had elsewhere. You can get a burger and fries or a gyro with hand-carved meat---and dozens of other delicious options.  Something else that I like about it is that I met the owner on my first visit there. Jim--a nice, down to earth guy who loves sharing his penchant for craft beer! His presence adds to the "friendly neighborhood restaurant" atmosphere.   Bring friends, family or just yourself. Enjoy great food, craft beer (many that you won't find anywhere else) and the camaraderie of others who want to know your name.  I am a big fan!! Tell them Jackie sent you!!

Ny3mI6K5Uwu6YLPl-RDuYg.text: This place has the worst chicken wings i have ever had !  Buffalo Wild Wings, Native New Yorker, Streets of New York,  Taekwoods, First Round Draft, all have better wings than this place.    I also went back a second time.  I had the angus platter, which was basically a hamburger patty with 2 sides. My girlfriend had the Gyro, which she said was not very good.  The only good thing in can say about this place is the beer selection.

QVz9fazRvqKZ1ASazAegDQ.text: Great craft beer selection! Liked our waitress, Theresa, seems to be a good place with good people & friendly staff. The wings were pretty tasty (try the "Crazy" Bbq), we want to try them grilled also. Liked the variety of ways you can order your wings, nice touch. We had a greek quesadilla too, it was good, meat was tender, but could be improved slightly (maybe add some feta cheese?) They have lots of TV's so we expect it to be a good place to watch some events. (No UFC though - too bad!) We were really impressed with the CRAFT BEER & the always rotating menu - keeps things fresh & us wanting to come back for more!! So far, I'm a fan!

MHdGZhUlbhuErcQc2v4TWw.text: I have gotten wings from the Monk before and they are always on the light side from flavor but usually very meaty and seem fresh.  Tonight we got buffalo and honey hot wings to go to.  The wings had almost no flavor.  The sauce was extremely light and there was no hint of salt or pepper.  I sent an email to management and I haven't heard anything back yet.

gDcPCoR5w7MDvWVa_qxnJg.text: Ick.  As a pescatarian, and starving for some good protein, I ordered the shrimp bowl with some mixed veggies and sweet and our sauce.  Every component in that dish  tasted like it was defrosted.  Screwing up rice takes effort, and even the rice wasn't that good.  Beer selection was good and I appreciated the menu describing the taste and rating of each beer.  The waitress was pretty nice, but none of that makes up for the lousy food.  My BF ordered the pulled pork sandwich and he said it was ok, but not great.  I guess you have to be a mammal meat eater to like it here.

Hr9dHsk__97i7AfzE_yXLw.text: I noticed I needed to update this review.  The Hungry Monk is by far the best place to have craft beers and great service in Chandler.  Jim does an outstanding job with his craft beef selection and there is always something new on tap. I was just in for lunch yeseterday and visited twice on Monday. (Hot Scotchy-wow!)  I cannot say enough good things about the beer and service at this very wonderful neighbourhood pub.

hyaomTPd7lwXqCzgMSHtyQ.text: The Valley Beer Drinkers Meetup Group has been coming here for months - since before the name change - on occasional Wednesdays for $3 craft pints & the fantastic wings special. We've always had a good experience, and the extensive, rotating brew selection keeps the venue fresh.  I've been urging the owner to add at least ONE Pilsner to the IPA-heavy menu, and last night he delivered with a quintessential model: Munchener Spaten Pils! It was great.  Adding to the experience was the excellent food. Portions were generous and satisfying!. One member ordered the Fish & Onion Rings, and when it arrived, two others immediately ordered their own! I can't remember better fish (pollack here) or more perfect onion rings! Homemade potato chips were remarkable, and the fry cook definitely knows the craft! Diners have many options for sides w/ entrees, which is a generous touch. Only the cole slaw was a bit bland.   Service was friendly & generally good, but not attentive enough later in the meal. Thanks for separate checks, too.  I really look forward to returning for brews and to further explore the enticing menu!

Mmis83xJ1ukVy50lPdTMHQ.text: Fun place to hang out with friends. Ask one of the bartenders to make you a night cap if you're in the mood for a really strong and creamy drink. Do not be fooled by taste.

-6KVvHITxs5k5JzQQ7TZXA.text: Great atmosphere here!  You feel like coming back all the time.  The best hot wing flavors.  My favorite was peanut and hot chills.  But the boneless wings are so good.  Perfect juiciness and crust.  I love this place.  The service was excellent too.

Q6O-OwaPjRPIapYQjuYcmw.text: We recently moved to the area and stumbled across the Hungry Monk since it's close to our home.  We have been here several times in the past 2 months and absolutely love it.  The service from John, Ashley and a few others have been great!  John knows our family by name and has made some great recommendations on drinks and food items.  My son is on a mission to try everything on the menu!  We have tried many items from buffalo wings, turkey burger, pulled pork sandwich, fall off the bone ribs, onion rings, sweet potato fries, gyro salad, quesadilla, chili, etc and have not had a bad meal yet!  The prices are very reasonable for what you get.  We love that we found a local go to spot for our family.  Advice: do not go on a big game night around 6pm, it gets packed!  Every other time we've gone, we were seated right away!  See  you soon, Hungry Monk!

CFtaEpHDZmQznrghWqDJeg.text: Love the Monk. Beer selection is always different and exciting. Great place to be adventurous and find a new beer! Food is consistently good, make sure you sit in Brandy's section, best waitress ever! Owner is friendly. Also has many healthy options!

BU7dzf08QpNVOn4Zm4kFmQ.text: Still a good place for beer, but don't order a mixed drink here. I'm not a mixed drink snob, but they just can't get anything right in the well. I've ordered three long islands here and all three were vastly different drinks, and none of them resembled anything close to a standard long island. I've ordered a few standard bourbon/whiskey drinks and none of them came out correctly either.   The beer selection is great!

_EQqiwsybOhvfx_hgdw_MA.text: The Quick & Dirty: If you love craft beer, you should check out the Monk.   The Long:   Atmosphere: 3 Stars.  Nothing to see here as this is your typical bar. TVs, bar tables, etc. This isn't necessarily a bad thing... just don't come here expecting anything more than a sports bar.   Food: 3 Stars.  Again, typical sports bar. I've tried two things at the Monk and I wasn't awed. I've had the chicken street tacos and the shrimp street tacos. The first time I had the shrimp tacos, they were delicious! The second time, the shrimp wasn't fresh and was very fishy. I also tried my husband's sandwich once (don't remember which one) and it was just OK. I've heard from friends that their wings are very good so maybe I'll check those out next time.   Drinks: 5 Stars.  They have a excellent draft beer menu. Varied selection and it changes with every visit. While my husband is enjoying an IPA from Michigan, I can be enjoying a Porter from Colorado.

_9NlS-RJIyT8JqcWePjrBA.text: Love love love this place!  We come here because its close to our apartment and because it has great beer selection for my bf. Food is great! I love the honey hot wings!  The salads are fresh and great as well.  Breakfast is good to.  You know it's not frozen and then put in a microwave. The service is awesome too!  They actually talk to you more than asking how your food is or are you ready for your check.  They make conversation and make more of a connection with their guest!  Oh as well pet friendly on the patio!

qqSnthIYUjNqUeeayPdzpw.text: I love the beer here.  They have a great selection of local beers, and the beer flight is a great way to sample a bunch of them.    The food I've had is okay.  The wings are pretty good, but I would not recommend the Mediterranean pita or shrimp tacos.    Service is friendly.

mp63HhdMKGznkIsJFB5vxQ.text: Good bar food.  Nothing too fancy,  but delicious food.  Great beer selection with a nice little outdoor patio.

xBBl3sZ3HqXVnwwI6vIbNw.text: I love his place!! Great sandwiches ham and cheese on pretzel bun with sweet potato fries my fav., lotsa beers on draft!

MW_nv6FM-0lZ98h7kG8J2w.text: We'll done!!! Great craft selection on tap, always new beers on deck. Reverse happy hour worked out great, got a flight and the wings were really good! The bar staff has it dialed in, and know there beers.

24xMs9JonU_L9x1ORTTcaA.text: This place was amazing the food was great. My game was on multiple tvs! My bf got a gyro which he loved and I got a spicy teriyaki chicken bowl also perfect. I order a salad with balsamic dressing and I wasn't the biggest fan of the dressing and our server Eileen was so sweet and attentive she offered me a different salad but didn't try to force me into ordering a new one. When I got the bill she had it removed which I didn't ask for or expect... We will defiantly be returning!! Even if the food wasn't amazing we would go back because Eileen was such an awesome server! Go here!!!!

LJmCWqPAshi2rns3495NVA.text: The servers are great. The Wednesday 3 dollar craft beer is great too! But they love their IPAs and ales. Personal preference: I wish there were more Hefe's on the beer list. Don't order mixed drinks there, you'll be disappointed! It's a beer pub and a damn good one!    I haven't been back there for awhile because of how crowded it gets. The location is so small and loud! The secret got out and  everyone flocked there :(. Now it's very loud so I miss having good conversations with friends when I went.     Their food is "meh". It's bar food, burgers, fries, gimmicky rice bowls (?)- so it is usually a hit or miss. I find myself just ordering chicken tenders and they're A-OK.   The service is great. I'm not sure if they are still there but Mike and Martise (sorry, I have no idea how to spell your name :p!) are always friendly and personable. Thanks Hungry Monks for the good times!

mQKuPAQXkbLCM_j-bEkUGw.text: Can't believe how many craft beer selections they have there! One thing I like about the monk is that they constantly update their tap list.  I'm a craft beer drinker. This place makes me happy :p. If you like Michigan beer this is the place to be.  The owner is from Michigan originally, so he tries really hard to put Michigan beers on the tap.  I have been there a few times since I moved to Chandler and every experience was really good!

FgXAKXGVhBlmIVjsltl0hA.text: Tuesday trivia nights.  Awesome weekly specials.  Seriously badass beer selection.  Only down fall is no UFC.  But plenty of other places have that.  This place is my go to spot.

z_zV29U-mJaSj8cR1wLjzQ.text: We went for the first time this Sunday for lunch. The server was very nice and the place its self had a nice atmosphere; open, clean, and decorated. I ordered the Pulled Pork Sandwich and my BF ordered the Battered Fish Sandwich, we both got the seasoned fries. I will say their seasoned fries were AWESOME! Very very good. My BF said his sandwich was great but my pulled pork was a bit dry. It did come with BBQ sauce so I used that to help the dryness. It wasn't overly loud and everyone seemed friendly. My only other reason, other than my dry pork, for the 3 star rating are the prices. Both of our sandwiches were $9.00 a piece and I think it's just a tad too high. $8.00 would have more fairly priced. Overall we were satisfied and would give them another try.

ycXr7f0J_syZABmZoHui6w.text: I've eaten here a couple of times with my kids.  My dining experience there was ok.  The food is typical.  I really like wings and pretty much order them everywhere I go.  I expected more from this place, since the word "wings" is in the name of the restaurant.    I'd eat here again if someone invited me to meet them there... and if they paid.

UeOufmRvDiCi_Ay7M9fAVg.text: Good neighborhood pub. Loved the crazy wings, and the fried mushrooms. Good selection of beers, and people. Low key, good to sit and watch a game. If you want to hang out and not he rushed this is a good option.

pIpHxykwuARMcM3g_OYs4w.text: Wasn't impressed.  Heard so many good things from other people but really, it's just another bar with a descent amount of beer on draft with mediocre food. Don't go here expecting it to change your life or really anything more than average local brews with a few specialties here and there. I'd MUCH rather go to Boulders or Papago, especailly since either don't have a blinding amount of light...

jM_onBWj4PbA17tsxcOqTg.text: Monk was great. I had the chicken sandwich and was very impressed, lots of flavor. Great selection of beers and plenty of tvs in not only the bar area.

sbHmJRMZ3d8qDBTORC9D9Q.text: I love the Hungry Monk. It's a long drive from Glendale to get here, but I meet my sister here (she lives in Tempe) some Saturdays to play trivia from 7p-9p. We usually arrive at 6p to eat before trivia starts.   Every bit of food I have ordered from here tasted fantastic! Good burgers, good wings, ribs, good pretzels and cheese, good buffalo cauliflower, and the fish and chips is the BEST I've had anywhere in the entire state!  They are consistent, and food and drink prices are VERY reasonable. Plus you can win $30, $20 or $10 playing trivia (1st, 2nd, 3rd place) that you can use on your next visit.  We eat here about twice a month and it's always easy to get seated, service is always good and the food is fantastic!

e0GK5DOvYYbBA5RkW9I9iw.text: The catfish didn't have too much of a Cajun flavor. The service was great. Clam chowder soup was watery but flavorful.

DWxh8LB1PJhqyVcQM6KkiQ.text: The best part about our visit at Hungry Monk was the soda,  listening to the The Thong Song, and that our server was really nice.  I really wanted to like this place since it's close to the house but I just can't.   We ordered 10 boneless honey hot wings, they were ok, not great. I prefer the wings at Zipps or Native much better. I ordered a chicken pita with chips, chicken was dry and even adding the sauce was still pretty flavorless.   My boyfriend ordered a burger and onion rings,  the cheese was sliding off the burger and he said it just tasted greasy. Onion rings were cold. He sent the whole thing back and ordered a Philly Cheese steak, said the cheese whiz had a very sharp flavor but not a fan but the seasoned fries were ok.   Chances are we probably be passing on this place, pretty disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Medium honey hot wings

V-3NEFkbyZRqP-E8a96RhA.text: This monk is no longer hungry, but like the ascetic he is, he is not satisfied. The food is okay, but that's about it.

uPBGNZ7Ci1k4YHxZ9nZP6Q.text: I tried it for the first time and was highly disappointed. My food felt like they had soaked it in a bucket of water before serving it to me. (Takeout) I opened my chicken wrap and the lettuce was brown and slimy. The fries were not fully cooked. What few bites I did have caused me to spend the remainder of my work day vomiting in the restroom. Never again. On a positive my coworkers ordered wings and loved them.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. The lettuce they serve people.

bb_VCKacMl5VXiKdp4n_Jg.text: The best wings in chandler I swear! I love wings, I eat them at least twice a week, and these are better than any others (I have tried Thai Peanut and Buffalo Regular, Buffalo is the best) Yes, it's noisy in here but you'll never have trouble watching the game, plenty of flat screens in here!   Service was great too, the one time I was in a rush, our waitress got us in and out in a hurry. My new favorite dinner place :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Only half the TV&#39;s that are in this joint!

zhr_gteoPATf23OezIbb3g.text: I was here for the first time last night and had a great time.  It was their 5th anniversary and they had a lot of rare beers on tap.  I loved the Lumberyard Imperial Hi Water IPA aged in George Dickel barrels.  The parmesan garlic wings were very tasty as well!

9fc5rpmWVLUw7ceIhZXLzg.text: This place is great place for casual dining, friendly staff and Great food. Try the Brewtus Wings- YUM!

aFGsveLSRBPwVBHEJHqx_w.text: Love this place. Highly recommend the Trippel. Great selection of beers. Only reason I didn't go 5 stars is that they reduced the amount of beer cheese dip for their pretzel appetizer. They have fresh made pretzel sticks with a die for beer cheese dip but last time we were in there was just 1 tiny cup that only had enough dip for 2 out of the 4 pretzels. Minor gripe however, service is good, good is good, beers are great!  Again get the trippel, you won't be disappointed.

sibVAoqvbT04DnxXFlXWpw.text: A friend wanted to visit the Monk, so I went there again for the first time in years. To my absolute total lack of surprise, they screwed up my order repeatedly, took forever, and even lost part of it. The exact same problems I listed in my review nearly three years ago.  They have a nice beer list, and the owners and staff seem very friendly. Just a shame they also seem to perpetually have no idea what they're doing.

gO6uyh8-3zl7xo9pXjDe1A.text: Eh. It's OK. Not great, not bad. Uninspired.  I had a grilled chicken sandwich.  Hard to mess that up.  It was fine.  No seasoning, though.  No evidence it was marinated.  Nothing.  Just grilled.  My wife had the chicken wings.  She wasn't impressed.  Normally she loves this sort of thing, but these she says weren't that good.  Service was fine.  Lots of TVs to watch whatever sports may be going on at the time.  I can't really recommend them.  "Meh" covers it.  Not really bad, but not particularly good either.  You could do much better without having to drive too much further.

3dmr86TDoj22c9tCIYvFtg.text: I never brag about sports bars or anything close to it. How is it that these guys make a killer quesadilla (the wrap is actually CRISP, not soggy) and killer tater tots (again, CRISP) where everyone else fails at both? I have no idea. Props just for that. Staff is amazingly friendly and they remembered my order from day one. Feels like a Cheers bar. Huge fan. Must visit. You won't be disappointed in the food (which, let's be honest, is usually mediocre at best in a sports bar), the atmosphere or the staff.

2_9Oj4elaWZfU6ao5tb6KA.text: It's ok. The Buffalo cauliflower is good but they need to work on their nachos. I mentioned that they were burnt and the server said, "that's how we make them!" Had to wait a while to get beers too. It's sucks when you have to flag the server down.

t_Hguy62Vg_F4MW8NALcDg.text: I have been multiple times and the place has gone down hill. Great concept, bad service

C09dIYqhGIltPVNpGhL1NQ.text: Stopped by here to get a quick bite. It was better than expected. As vegetarians, it's sort of hard to out in places like this, but this place accommodated us well.  The fried buffalo cauliflower was so yummy, as was the soup and veggie gyro. Some of the people we were with had wings, and they said they were pretty good as well.   The place loses a star for two reasons: one the air conditioner was on waaaay too low. The place was absolutely freezing. This may be good for those drinking and watching the game, but not so great for those just trying to enjoy a meal. Also, the food was a little slow coming out too.  Overall it was good, and may go back if I was ever in that area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Veggie gyro
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. French onion soup
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Buffalo Cauliflower (what is left of it... Ops!)

VbQlhXgPKuZyniNSbK6g6g.text: I come here every single Tuesday for .59 wings and $2 beers and our bartender Marci is absolutely amazing! She remembers our order, is extremely friendly, and keeps the beers coming. Keep up the excellent service, Marci!   The wings are fantastic and I could eat their blue cheese by the spoonful- if you're a blue cheese fan, you've gotta try it. Great wing flavors like honey mustard and Jamaican Me Crazy! Fun atmosphere with Trivia on Tuesdays and plenty of beers on tap. Living in the area, I drove past this place countless times because it doesn't look like much... But it is now my favorite bar around.   Try it out!  .59 regular wing Tuesdays .59 boneless wing Wednesday

TmByKz-r2E-SUvEXgxuMbw.text: Met a friend there for happy hour March 7 2018 and we sat at our usual table. Cole A was our server again .... sigh. He has always been a bit aloof but this time he was down right rude. We ordered a round of beers and some chips and salsa. Another group came in after we had our beers and within a few minutes we saw them being served with chips and salsa. We suspected they should have been at our table but said nothing. Our beers were done and here comes Cole and asks if we want another round. We said sure and by the way what happened too our chips and salsa. Cole says rather curtly " hey don't worry they'll be right out". So a couple minutes go by and he comes out and says that he found out that our order went to the table next to us by mistake. We told him we knew that and that s why we asked about our order. So Cole disappears and never returns to our table until our beers are gone. We get another round and a chip refill and Cole disappears again. So our beers are gone and no Cole. We see him on the other side of the restaurant serving tables. I guess since we are in the bar area he must have forgotten us. So Cole finally shows up and we ask for our bill. Our friend leaves him cash and we have to wait on our card. Cole comes back and says "Have a nice evening" and as he walks away mutters"asshole" under his breath. I couldn't believe my ears. I almost wanted to confront him about it but just left.... without leaving him a dime. I have been going there for years on a regular basis. I will never be back.

1clJEijZJv_2m0rafQafcA.text: Came here on Black Friday not busy at all. Had a turkey burger with sweet potato fries and my fiance had a beef burger made to order and both were delicious. Service was good and a chill place to come eat and have a beer

0rKMGLHuMEFDnAH65dF30g.text: First timer here at The Hungry Monk. The service was great however I really like the male services that was serving next to us. I kind of wish he was our services just because he seem to be a little more knowledgable of the food and drinks. The food was okay, it wasn't the best but it was bad. I'll probably be back for their Thursday $1 tenders night. I will say however that this place is GREAT  for prices of beer and alcohol (even though I didn't drink this time around). #Ono

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. 3 Honey Hot tenders

4nNJqtLv9sDd1ihIIm2jEg.text: This is my Cheers, my neighborhood bar. Owned and operated by friends, this is my go to place when i want a bite and a few really good beers, and don't want to wander far from home. The ever changing craft beer menu is incredible and what caused places like Applebee's to vacate Chandler altogether. They just couldn't compete. The menu, in part originally created by my long time good friend and beer expert King James Swann, is a bit like my old hangout in Phoenix where he also worked, Hazelwoods 1st place. (They were known for their wings ;).       Upon permanently relocating to Chandler, the proximity to the Monk was actually part of my house buying decision. I have to have a good neighborhood bar close by. Its a must. I need wings! The owner Jim is a cool guy, the bartenders are all awesome and like friends. I love the regulars too. People often underestimate the importance of a good bartender/libation therapist. Plus theres like 57 TVs to watch sports on. Go Monk!

XeVWfIqiwZwFK-58TIhpjA.text: When we want a quick bite to eat we go here.  Great food and great beers on tap.   I always get the sweet potato fries, nuclear wings are not spicy at all.  Wish they'd take the spicyness level up a few notches. Sometimes the service is a bit slow, but other than that we're definitely regulars.

JJMFdcfcdF3DLdDDlwTGyg.text: I really wanted to like this place more because of the nice beer selection they have.  Downside is that it has kind of a low life neighborhood sports bar type of atmosphere inside. Food choices were heavily dependent on grease also. Not that healthy and the bartender had kind of a lousy snotty nose punk kid attitude towards my wife's beer questions.

Kcg2g1CuoVJeJRIb5tdDqA.text: TAKE OUT EXP - BEEN A FAN OF HUNGRY MONK BACK WHEN THE NAME WAS BUFFALO WINGS RINGS AND THINGS!! I LOOOOVE the food their! Especially the chicken strips for a buck on Thursdays! I have not ate in but i have done take out almost every week for the past year and the service is getting worse and worse. I call and tell them separate orders, and they put them all on the same ticket. One of the sauces is usually wrong and instead of grilled they will give me regular fried chicken. They stopped honoring my company's 15% discount... I DID GO EVERY WEEK!!!

D-NOeW2S6dWFt61bDc9JIg.text: A solid 3.5.  I thought of rounding down because the bill surprised me a little, but the service won out in the end. I was expecting a Native New Yorker-type place so I was flustered when I saw the extensive beer list- I quickly ordered something the waitress just told me they were out of, then changed it to just a Blue Moon, then asked what stouts she recommended before settling on... a pear cider.  Then I sat and pouted as I read over all the other beers I should have ordered instead, daring not change my order yet again and confirm all suspicions that I'm a jackass.  Fortunately, the inner turmoil was quelled when the drinks came- the cider was excellent. The boyfriend and I ordered 10 wings, a burger for him, and a patty melt for me.  The wings were great- I never order boneless so was surprised to basically get chicken strips, but juicy nuggets of meat with a crisp, sauce-basted exterior works for me.  The boyfriend said his burger was great and I thought the patty melt was just about perfect.  My only complaint was that the grilled onions were just this side of raw, but it's not stopping my mouth from watering thinking about the leftovers currently sitting in my fridge.  His fries seemed average but my chips were great, though not hot which is nice for homemade.  10 wings, 2 beers, and 2 sandwiches came to just under $40 before tip, but this was a Saturday night with no specials, not the usual circumstances under which I frequent wing joints. Next time I'd try to go during a happy hour, but I can definitely see a next time.

Nqqo3phlOvPX_5HPmA1B2Q.text: Love this place. Been coming here since it opened a couple years ago. Actually, I frequent this place quite often. Has an amazing beer selection, carry a lot of micro-brews. Plus, the atmosphere and food is great. Can't go wrong with this place, always a good time. Try the grilled ham and cheese on pretzel bread.

VTJmhcbIe_mAIPxx8Z5kzQ.text: First off I have been a patron of BWR & Hungry Monk for the last 3 years. When I first started going there, the service was awesome, the beer was unbelievable and the prices were fair. I loved this bar and told everyone about it. But in the past 6 months, I have noticed the service sucks and the prices are ridiculous! This just makes me mad enough to notice they are always out of the beer I want and the food is awful. Too bad because if they did a little better on the service and stopped being stingy on the prices - I would still be a patron.

Z4hWoOtkPFfRkTIb4rNEKg.text: Great beer selection, decent wings with good spice. Not a huge deal, but we had a coupon from the 2011 Entertainment book that the server refused to take since they dropped the Buffalo Wings and Rings name (even though the sign is still hanging out front and the coupon was specific to that location)

ej7SbSPzx7j0SAg2eYDe4A.text: The food is great and it's good to see a place supporting other local suppliers. Plus the staff has bee great each and every time I've been there

ecWq7NqcI1yF67wBuVonPw.text: This is a great little place that opened up in an old buffalo wild wings space.  They have a GREAT selection of beers, good wings, good access to tvs/sports and good customer service.  My friend is a beer aficionado and so the extensive selection of draught beers in a small venue like this is awesome. PLUS - you can create your own beer sampler for $5!  Seriously, does it get better than that?!  Why yes! It does!  Wednesdays all pints are $3 and boneless wings are $0.59/a piece. I'm officially fan!  The only downside right now is the heavy construction in front of the place and the lack of an official sign (come on guys - let's get rid of the BWW sign and get yours UP THERE), but it's definitely worth overlooking those two issues.

t2d0NU2eYmgGj7fB13hN_w.text: So if you sing The Humpty Dance on karaeoke people DON'T like that?? Not such a fun crowd. I think my table was just way too fun for everybody else! Well, if you pick a Journey song, of COURSE we are going to help you sing! Duh! I personally loved our rendition of You and me baby ain't nothin but mammals....everyone else, not so much. Whatever. I had fun. Food was average. For my first time, wasn't so happenin'!

qsb0HPEA1TgPHUaces0p5g.text: Great beer selection with mediocre food!  The service is painfully slow.  We have been there 3 times and each time we have waited at least 10 minutes before being acknowledged.  They are always understaffed.  The last time we were there, we asked for the manager, since our server was also tending bar on a busy Friday night.  The manager seemed a little irritated that she had to be "bothered" to take our order.  We still go back because they serve some of our favorite beers on tap~ We will just go when we have loads of free time to wait for service!

9eEXBWlePIiMtQFnm2JVfg.text: I have to say how pleasantly suprised I am everytime I walk walk in and see the craft beer selection at this place.  Its wonderful. My husband says Jim the owner personaly selects each of the beers on tap.  I have to say that he has great taste!  The local breweries are great places to go, but this place has beer from all of them! HEAVEN.

aOsWZ_Nd7j8phvdxZAGetg.text: Great selection of craft beers.  The service is always great as well.  The Abby Chips are the best.  Order them with the spices BBQ sauce.  You're gonna love it.

4nOGKHNjiEfU2W_1fBEOVw.text: My husband and I visited The Hungry Monk on a Saturday night. It was trivia night, so there was a woman announcing trivia questions/answers over the PA in between songs. If you weren't there to play trivia, it was kind of ruined the ambiance. We arrived before the trivia began, but didn't receive any info on how to play from the hostess or our server. We didn't really want to play, but it would have been nice to have been provided with the information, in case we did want to play.   The restaurant was pretty busy, maybe because it was trivia night. We waited for a couple minutes to be greeted by a hostess and finally be seated, then waited for a few more minutes for our server to make it to the table. I ordered the Pear Ale to drink and we each had water. The pear ale was good, but kind of pricey ($4.50 for 16oz), maybe I'm just used to ordering drinks during happy hour pricing. We ordered the fried mushrooms for an appetizer. My husband ordered the original gyro and I ordered the veggie pita. The soup/salad came out after about 10 minutes, before the appetizer. I ordered my salad with the balsamic vinaigrette dressing- it was oily and herb-y. Not very good, and I had to keep picking the herbs out of my teeth. My husband got the chili; he said it would have been better if they would have sprinkled some cheese on it. After we had almost finished our soup/salad, I asked the server if our appetizer was almost done- it then took another 10 minutes for the mushrooms to make it to the table. They were pretty good, but I honestly think the server forgot to put our appetizer order in, after waiting for so long, they really should have been COMP'ed. Our entrees were good, nothing too spectacular, but not bad. As we were finishing up our meal, they seated a party of 8 beside us, when there were only 6 chairs at the table. It kind of made us feel rushed out because there were a couple people standing near our table waiting for us to leave. I wouldn't go back on a night when they were doing trivia; I might consider checking them out during Happy Hour. Overall, the food was OK and the service was very slow.

HNc0RqHUrMNHj2MXOnlMvw.text: This revu is for the one in the back of cfc, not sure if this is the same place. Ordered a Guinness n some hot buffalo wings while I got my ipad skinned. Both were tasty. A big place, lots of games w/o the dive bar smell, vid poker, trivia, n lots n lots of tv's. Nice casz place. Visit it.

WiBPS7DRBnn0VUEk3qSV6A.text: I can't tell you enough how much I truly enjoyed this place!!! The place was packed when we arrived. The hostess sat us promptly and ensured us our waitress would be right over. The spunky little thing came over to us and took our drink order. With as busy as they were she still had enough time to explain some beers to me and give me some great recommendations. We noticed the table next to us had an array of chicken tenders and sauces. We got their recommendation and ordered us some chicken tenders which I might add are only .99 a tender. They were great tasting, moist, and crunchy. I like that you can add "heat" to the tenders them self or to any of the sauces they have available. Then the meeting of the regulars began. What an amazing group of people we met there. Everyone was so friendly and so down to earth. I have found my new waterhole. Wednesday nights they have boneless chicken wings for .59 and Thursday .99 tenders and Trivia on Saturday!!!! LOVE THIS PLACE =)

wns4PvAhxu0Y-luhphvgTA.text: What a find!  Very hip staff, awesome music and delicious food. I'll definitely be going back!

DhLOMSYhtgooZkHRZoABSA.text: Ok, this isn't my usual type of eating place. But i went with a friend and dang was I surprised. The place first off was clean as a whistle. We were greeted at once and seated quickly. The server was so friendly and inquired if it was our first time there....I like that. She explained the concept and menu. The chicken tenders were huge and fresh not frozen. The beer I had (3 to be exact) were craft beers and ice cold n yummy..the way I like them. The server did all the right things and the owner Jim, stopped by our table to check on us....that is HUGE for me and shows a hands on owner that really cares for both his staff and customers. Seemed to be a lot of regulars that knew each other in the bar area..I like that too. I highly recommend this place....it is a chain but it it is run like and independent operation. Kudos to this place

SIxtNFOUTwgDan04m3URJw.text: Love the beer selection and the wings put BWW to shame.

oFammkeuvxqkeKvB_BxHZA.text: I love to come here to watch sports, and they have great beer selection that is constantly changing so you can always try something new.

plPJFpwaDyv3CUmNbEkfNg.text: Had happy hour at this place with some coworkers. Ended up having the teriyaki boneless tenders (99 cent special!). They were juicy and fried to perfection. Also picked up the hungry monk nachos which were gone before I knew it. Lastly great beers on draft. Ended up having the Black Market Hefeweizen, deliciously fruity. Will definitely come back!

LqAVhWXiwKgNrx7-2CJ3Tg.text: Can't say enough good we had the fish fry was very good peach or catfish servicer was great. We'll be back

2tfo1rY-ghQiLCA01EN0ng.text: Tasty wings and sauces. The kids and adults all ate enough and were filled up. A huge selection of beers on tap and off, several people in my group experienced tasty brews.  Restaurant has multiple TVs on multiple walls which makes this a great spot for watching sports. The wait staff I've experienced was accommodating and friendly- very willing to explain menu and grab us a high chair.  I'd definitely recommend this place and I'll be visiting again!

i8N3IXO5w4uANrqMcfXDCQ.text: Nice enough waiter but I made the massive mistake of ordering a rice bowl. Asked for shrimp and veggies. It came out with plain white rice, several small waterlogged thawed shrimp and little teriyaki sauce drizzled over it. It looked like something you would see at a prison if the cook serving 50 to life was trying to be creative and didn't have any other ingredients available to him. Terrible presentation. Terrible quality. Will never return here unless I just need alcohol or want to sit in a booth that has severely cracked plastic that tear my pants up. So gross. Would give it a zero of I could

fWyrZ0FqLiVCVyYEVfVmUg.text: I was at the Hungry Monk on 6/22/12   I did not eat anything here, so I cannot review the food - However, I did have some drinks & sat at the bar & also in the dining area.    The first thing I noticed was that the music was EXTREMEMLY loud.  Because of this, everyone pretty much has to shout to be heard - By the time the place got busy, I could not wait to get out of there just so my ears could get a break!  The bar was clean & the service was fast.  I was a little disappointed with the "happy hour" drink prices - I was just drinking Coors LIght, and they were $3.25 apiece.  Happy hour was $1 off beer, so that means $4.25 for a Coors Light, normally - Yikes!  I moved to the dining area - The manager "Mike" was extremely helpful and friendly, but I think this is because he knew the other people I was seated with - Regardless, he was top notch in my book - Thank you, Mike.  The table I sat as was very wobbly - The staff made a comment that "Yeah - That table's been broken for a while", to which I thought "Well, if you KNOW it's broken, why don't you fix it?"  DUH!    A member of my party ordered boneless chicken wings, and they got bone-in by mistake - The problem was fixed, but it took a little bit of time.  I would not bring kids here because it is very loud, and it is really an "adult" place.  Everyone is screaming, the beer is flowing, smokers on the patio......Yeah - No - I would not bring kids here.  If the atmosphere was more comfortable, and if the prices were more reasonable, I would rate it higher.

Nkjfu4cfmJYa7kcMWb4rXQ.text: Great bar menu. Cheap scotch. Awesome beer selection.  Definitely a great place to have drinks, just make sure you eat before you come. They have the worst food ever. I honestly don't understand how they've received a single award for their food. It's always bland or weird and usually over cooked.  I'd grab a cocktail here any day but I'd get a pizza delivered if I got munchy.

s34z2QC4Mel_Ojb1NlT1qQ.text: The beers on tap change every time I'm there. The favorites always stay. There food is a step up for the average bar food. It has a gourmet twist. Try the Martise special wing sauce. Can't really explain what's in it but it's darn good.   They have trivia on Saturday nights at 8. It's a blast. Get there early because it fills up.   Youthful fun wait staff    Overall a great neighborhood joint that never disappoints.

uIwHMvnh468X_NWxihPq2w.text: We go here because the grandparents like it here.  It is OK.  The staff are friendly.  They keep my in-laws happy.  Sometimes that is more important and really great food.  I've only had the chicken fingers which are not great but edible enough.  They have good options for kids, and "ICE CREAM!!!", so my young daughter is always a happy camper.  Again, sometimes that is more important than really great food. ;)

kFj0KpYsLRWz9nBT7iG1Dw.text: Stopped in by myself during happy hour. Sat at the bar. Drank a Lost Abbey quad. Surrounded by Coors Light slobs. Excellent and friendly service.

W1_JU3pqg_cZTV8gO1vNtA.text: The boy, our friend Kat A, and I were hungry at midnight, so after yelping a bit, we found ourselves at The Hungry Monk. It was pretty late, so the only food they could make us was fried food, but we were okay with that! I think it was a Friday night, so $3 margaritas yayyy! My favorite haha (:  We had a great time! Kat loves those claw machines, so I think she spent about $5 on it, but didn't win anything. I forget the name of the guys who helped us, but they were really cool&helpful. I looooved their fried mushrooms oh my god get those. Seriously. Bomb dot com.  If I ever go back to AZ, I'd definitely stop by. Fried mushrooms&margaritas!

YqQak7R5BzLJKS4kjaN_wg.text: I've been to the monk several times.   Beer selection: 5 stars. Tap list frequently changes, good mix of local brews, and a variety of styles.   Service: excellent, good recommendations on beer, very friendly and helpful  Food: pretty good. It's a sports bar so don't expect gourmet.

hvPl2GkvWhX-AuQ4MJf5yg.text: I love to come here for Happy Hour on Wednesday nights.  Boneless wings are 60 cents each and drafts are $3 and I'm not talking about Coors or Bud light.  There is a whole list of craft beers you can choose from.  This place is always packed when I come. Even though it gets so busy, the service is always great.  They manage to make frequent stops to check up on you.

4xgbOMlugb2PQN8Xd6Ru-g.text: One of my favorites places for casual eats. Buffalo cauliflower is to die for, my kids love the housemade potato chips dipped in bbq sauce. Hubs tried the crabcake today and loved it. Owner is a super nice guy, came by the table to say hello. Reliable, delish, friendly place, and we really like supporting a local business. Wish it was closer to the house but just learned they have a food truck too, so now we gotta check that out sometime!

wfsZKYKZP5TGwSBmXc-FtA.text: So I'm not an a-hole who posts reviews about petty stuff at bars HOWEVER, when I drive all the way over to an establishment who's online posted hours are that they close at 12am on Sunday and then I walk up to locked doors at 9pm... walk in through the unlocked patio door and they tell me "during summer hours on Sundays we close at 9pm".... not cool... it's not even posted on a door outside or anything .... walked out and met 3 couples walking in to the same experience. Figure it out.

MJ14DA0OONVuwSCl4YxvmA.text: Well the food is good but the conversations we had to listen to from the staff was disgusting. I would somewhat get it if they were in the back and I heard it but they were sitting at a table eating at the table next to us having the conversation the whole time we were there.   They have lost my business for good and I won't be back.

jl5wT9M998A56PRaOak-PA.text: This place has a great rotating selection of beers.  They also have great food and beer specials.  Wednesday night is $3 most beers along with $0.59 boneless wings.  Both the boneless wings and chicken tenders are lightly breaded and have numerous flavors.  I highly recommend them for the price and the taste.  The place has several TVs showing various sitting events.  Check this place out, especially on nights where they have deals.

fcskBfEKrobO78YeEgBhUQ.text: Excellent small neighborhood bar feel !! Huge selection of drafts ! Very attentive staff ! Love this place

evmFWzaEqZG0IfDuaL_26w.text: I went on a Monday to have the all you can eat boneless wings and I was very pleasantly surprised.  The wings are delicious.  The Crazy Sauce was my favorite, it's sweet and tangy and hot all in one. I loved it. The Lemon Pepper was really good as well. I tried the peanut, it was ok but not as good as the Crazy Sauce or the regular sauce. Even if you only eat the 1st 10 and fries it's a great deal. The french fries are really delicious perfectly crisp and slightly seasoned, really good. I don't really drink beer but my friend said they had a really good selection and ordered a couple. The service is pretty slow, not sure why but it took everything forever. We sat in the booth for a good 10 minutes before anyone brought us a menu and took our drink order. Just as long for everything else. So just keep in mind that you're going to be there awhile when you go.

DKzaxe5NDl35NtapmU2nRg.text: We came here on a weekday looking for a drink after a bad experience with another restaurant down the street.   We were seated very quickly by a friendly waitress. The first thing we realized is that it  (the overhead music) was very loud. Incredibly loud. We could't hear each other from across our table and actually had to bend down and speak into one-another's ear to hear each other. My Fiance finally had to ask them to turn it down a bit, which they had no problem doing.   After that, it really wasn't a bad place. The bartender was very kind and skilled. She didn't over-pour or over-ice our drinks which is a big peeve of mine being a bartender myself.   The food is good or bad depending on who is working that day/night.  The staff and bouncers are all very laid-back and cool. Everyone is usually polite and the servers attentive. I would definitely come back.

3RkFPZ7NSvuaOVLxklTM0g.text: I will NEVER go back to this establishment!!!!  The food was good, the beer was good, but the drunks are out of control.  I went to the bar and sat next to a very nice couple who had come in to watch the Michigan game.  the game was on the bars main big screen TV.  About half time a guy came into the bar and immediately started being loud.  All of a sudden the TV changed to the Cubs game.  The couple immediately asked a man who appeared to be the manager/owner to change it back as they had come in early to the bar so they could watch the game.  The manager/owner agreed and the TV was changed back.  About 15 minutes into the 3rd quarter the loud guy who I witnessed have about 3 - 5 shots in a very short amount of time was now visibly drunk.  He turned around and started giving the nice couple a hard time and cussing at them because he wanted to see the Cubs on the big screen.  Mind you two other TV's closer to him were showing the Cub's game from about 7 feet away from him.  He wanted to know who the He*l they were and how much money had they spent in the place.  He continued to yell and cuss at the couple.  This was witnessed by several waitresses.  The bar manager/owner came out and spoke with the obviously DRUNK guy.  Not more than 20 minutes had passed when the DRUNK guy turned around and started to give the nice couple another hard time.  He yelled and cussed at them to leave.  Some of his friends also started yelling and cussing at the couple.  This was witnessed by the waitresses and the owner/manger who quickly came over and had ANOTHER discussion with the DRUNK guy.  He never kicked him out, or stuck up for the nice couple.  What a dump/sh*t hole of a place.  I hope he enjoys the drunks who were out of control, threatening and abusive.  You lost a customer for life!

mn_V1wLEmK131aZ16O3k3w.text: Food was great. Server was awesome. Kids menu and verbiage was very cool. The bandit plate had me cracking up! Brussels sprouts could have been a little crisper. Good happy hour and specials will be back 10 out of 10!

Sl-a2sxbSmUQ2m9QfsQRIQ.text: Came in for a drink and some apps. Took nearly 10 minutes for the bartender to greet me. Once I placed my beer order saw the bartender talking to regulars for a while before even checking on my drink then another 10 min went by and informed me the beer I ordered was out. Finally got a another beer and then ordered two apps. The apps took another 20 minutes and the bsrtender had stopped by twice to tell me they would be out soon. The boneless wings were tough and not good the sauce was watery . the fried pickles were the only highlight . you get a good amount for the price. The bartender seemed nice but was to pre oquipied and there should have been another person working.

Bl0DgVzJSnoSLuRiRh_nbA.text: I try to get here least once a week for the chicken wings the sliders and the cold draft beers I really appreciate the different tastes in they have sauces. Easily the best neighborhood bar in chandler.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wednesday&#39;s 65 cent bone in chicken week

qaHWGAe4u81r7E2I-MNUUA.text: Fun place, multiple choices for beers and the wings were good.  The service was quick and steady.  Definitely be coming back.  Wife's review: Hot wings were awesome!!! Ordered their Honey BBQ, Parmesan Garlic, Medium Wings and French fries.  This restaurant uses the wet sauce on their wings and .....WOW!!! Full of flavor!  Hands down, the garlic Parmesan was the best!  I think I converted my hubby from a BBQ flavor fan to garlic Parmesan!  Came back a second time!  Placed the same order except we added the CRAZY BBQ!! Awesomeness!!!. Had a great time catching up with an old boss!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Having a great time catching up with an old friend while enjoying wonderful food at Hungry Monk!

5q8I8VY-J7FtQXW0Suenlg.text: The live team trivia on Saturday nights is so fun!!! Such a fun atmosphere for friends. As far as the food, it's pretty average, with the exception of the fried pickles. The fried pickles are absolutely AMAZING!!!!! You can't visit this place without trying the pickles.

a7arFbI92Efz-hXwCYlW7g.text: Friends and I came in here on a whim during Christmas Eve when the Cardinals were playing and needed a place to eat/watch the game. The Monk was slow that day which made for quick service. The place was small but quaint and decorated like your average sports bar. Numerous TVs hung from the walls and we were able to see every game that was on.  We all ordered wings and some shareables and beer of course. Well the wings were nothing crazy pretty standard wings with the usual flavors that most sports bars offer, but wayyy better prices than that of a Buffalo Wild Wings for example. We ordered some different types of fries which were pretty standard but again great prices. The deep fried beer battered jalapenos similar to deep fried pickles but with a Jalapeno inside were very addicting!   The beer selection for such a small place did not let me down! Numerous beers on tap and in the bottle ranging from local breweries to out of state breweries and of course your standard domestics all for reasonable prices!  If you're looking for a new place to go in the Chandler area to watch your games and are tired of the usual chain sports bar try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sweet Potato Fries!
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wings!
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wings wings and wings!

BdZfqWHQjm5axS0xDzlO6A.text: This place is a gem for numerous reasons.  What an amazing beer selection!  They do something a bit differently that sets them a part from some other bars/pubs in the valley.  I think they rotate maybe 20-30% of their 30+ draft beers to bring in specialty and seasonal beers, all while keeping their best sellers (yes, they actually listen & pay attention to their customers, what a novel idea!) on draft so their patrons typically know where they can find their favorite beer and a smiling face serving it to them.  In my opinion, many bars/pubs rotate their draft beer selections far too much, which is ok for wanting to try something new every time, but what if I have a favorite like Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Huss Scottsdale Blonde, anything made by McFate Brewing, Bell's Two Hearted IPA, etc?  I want to know I can find a certain beer there when stop in if only for a beer & some food or a few.  Fair prices, genuinely good customer service and the owners really seem to care that things are done right and patrons are happy.  They've also got a chef there that pairs foods with really interesting flavors together than just make the food come alive.
