Wings are very solid, I do wish they had the option of smoking the wings...but that's just my preferred method.  This place is the church of bacon, they have weekly specials that usually involve some part of the tasty pig, and they do a great job on the pork.  Oh yeah, they buy so much high end beer, the distributors ensure this place gets all the good stuff..yes...specialty beers.  Love this place.

xOp-olQiY5BwE6upmrPwEw.text: Nice neighborhood place. We met a group on a Friday night. We had driven by a zillion times and didn't think to stop. The beer was very good and lots of choices. The burger and wings also were very good and the service especially on a busy night was excellent. We will be back. Love to support local

uwFidzjTeB5XoAbkm6oRTg.text: Service was friendly but food was not good. I ordered a patty melt and it was really dry.

2BAuKr2Py3VbO2RIwQJXLw.text: I had never seen my husband of 20+ years eat cauliflower, ever. And yet he devoured The Monk's Buffalo'd Cauliflower and house-made blue cheese dressing. He even ate a plate of Brussel sprouts with their sriracha orange sauce.   The staff was great at pairing craft beer with the innovative menu offerings.

FWHksQT-U_ybIozkuN3BhA.text: We love Hungry Monk! Whenever we don't have plans on Saturday night we head there for trivia. The food is good, we usually go for the Saturday night deal on gyros and they're always very tasty! We've also had wings and a couple of other appetizers there and I haven't been disappointed by anything on the menu.  They have a ton of beer on draft, which is awesome, and they have a lot of local Arizona brews which I love! My fiance and I stopped in a while ago around noon when he was getting new tires put on across the street, and had a couple of bloody Mary's, and those were very good too!  Service is great, we always ask for Courtney because we absolutely LOVE her, she is the sweetest! Whenever she's not there and we have different servers everyone else has always been great too however. I've never had a bad experience here and will continue to frequent this local watering hole!

63iuxgbKmEuqiZcO8Xfr_A.text: Ate in the patio. Had really good fried mushrooms. Really nice atmosphere paired with good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States

Is9TakzYdcF8lo_MwNrwMw.text: Heather, the bartender, is a really great girl! I came in alone a little while back just to relax and enjoy a beer. I could tell she knew I wanted to have my space, but she was still keeping a steady eye on me in case I needed anything, which was really nice. I don't always like having such chatty bartenders and feeling obligated to keep conversation. She reads people well, I can tell she knows when people want to talk and when others don't. So important! I love the Buffalo cauliflower here! It's so so good! It may sound a little different, but I promise it's so delicious! I enjoy sitting at the bar here. Everything has great prices as well. Overall, it's a great bar that's in a convenient spot for me. I will definitely be back, especially because heather was so awesome!

OXdGo89pEnZpiInzBIQxhg.text: Neat little place! Doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside has a cool atmosphere. Beer list is very impressive, and the happy hour specials are great. We will be back to try them! We came for lunch, and I had the gyro. My boyfriend got a burger and loved every bite. The food was great, and came out quickly. The service was very attentive and friendly. We will be back and bringing friends!

yOQLczo5RPkP_ifBKv4NaQ.text: Another full tummy on the best philly ever! Dig the f outta the food truck- restaurant just as good!

HZ9gtUfdlTmAVNxRMlVY8g.text: I personally love eating here.  Beer selection is different each time we come, the service, food and environment are always spot on.

pQerl7-a1oAT5H4VgnSp0w.text: Let me start by saying that it truly pains me to write this review. See, this was our go to spot for a long time. The food was tasty and the beer selection was awesome. We even coined a nickname for the place: Chicken and Sauce (you know, cause of their delicious wings and sauces).   So, we decided we wanted some chicken and sauce one night and ordered grilled tenders with lemon pepper, fried tenders with lemon pepper/hot, a Caesar salad and the Greek salad. When boyfriend arrived home with it, we were both supremely disappointed. The grilled tenders BARELY had any lemon pepper on them (when we dined in, they were always nicely coated) and the fried tenders had next to no lemon pepper and a slight drizzle of sauce. My Greek salad came with the wrong dressing, weird pieces of what seemed to be shredded pork, apple slices and cauliflower. I have had that salad there numerous times, and never once did it come with any of that shizz. The Caesar was the only thing that didn't disappoint.  Now, I'm in the restaurant industry, so for me to call and say something is a HUGE deal. I called and spoke with a female manager, who was super apologetic and wanted to compensate us with a gift card for our next visit. I told her that I appreciated it, but that's not why I called, but she insisted. We ordered take out again about two weeks later with the same disappointment and figured maybe they just weren't great with take out.  Fast forward about a three weeks later and we decided to dine in. We both ordered some beverages, which were fine and then our salads came out. Unfortunately, we had no silverware and our server was nowhere to be found. To be fair, they seemed short staffed but we ended up waiting a good ten minutes before my boyfriend walked over to find some. Our food came out pretty quickly after that and it was better than our previous take out debacles. Our server came over once to check on us and when we were finished it took forever for us to get the check. There was no manager presence on the floor, and for the amount of patrons in there, it would have been nice for someone to have been helping out the two servers we saw running around.   It sucks, because we really did enjoy going there, but after three strikes we just decided we'd rather spend our dollars elsewhere.

tw5NqWRUDnC-iglW6lIgvA.text: This place is awesome...Heather the bartender is great..the 2nd time we came in she knew our name..the food is great as well..we tried the gyro, hamburger, ham and cheese. French onion. Soup... definitely will be back

aIi-xJP0CEw3rUQi6rU9mQ.text: The trippel sandwich was delicious. But that's where the list of pros ends. Good beer list, but the waitress literally knew NOTHING about beer! We asked her what exactly a barleywine was, she looked at the list, and said "oh that section tells where the beer was made"... We then had to explain to her where the list of breweries was, and how that was different than the type. She also didn't know much about the menu Tortilla soup apparently means potatoes, carrots, and pork in broth with saltines... Not what I would call tortilla...  Train your staff better. Overall disappointing since I've had the food truck stuff before at a festival and remember really liking it

eki_gnKvYX7H96jKudmOWw.text: This has become one of our favorite places. We went for Arizona beer week and had so much fun. The beers on tap are an excellent variety. And I absolutely cannot get enough of the buffalo cauliflower! We met the owner and he was so nice. They have a new menu coming out that will include brussels sprouts! Yes! YUM. I love locally owned places like this. Great atmosphere, feels like a neighborhood pub! Highly highly recommend.

8GPCL-bqY5COSsm8XkCBgw.text: I had never tried the Hungry Monk before since I don't drink but I found them on a list of places with a happy hour until 7 so I wanted to bring a group of people there for a mid-week happy hour.  The Hungry Monk is a great place to bring a group. They have a big craft beer selection, a decent menu for a bar, and the staff were all fantastic. They have a huge communal table in the bar which is fun and tons of televisions for those sports minded folks. They also have large tables is the dining room that seat 10 comfortably.  I give them 4 stars out of 5 because their food is okay but not great. But I have only tried 4 menu items so far so I am not the best judge. But since I don't drink I can only judge the food!

JsN47P46Ybm3PDbceUR2Ng.text: There was room for improvement on each aspect of this visit. All you can eat fish and chips were burnt. Fries were good. Second batch of fish was even more burnt. We questioned how the cook and the bartender who served, "Deandra", did not see this, and recognize that the condition of the fish was unacceptable.  The wings were litteraly bathing in oil. It seemed as though it was some type of presentation technique, But, it was undesirable and should targeted for change immediately.  The burbon bbq burger, It was the most on par item of the set. However, there was a mismatch in the expectation of what medium represented. The onion ring on the burger was very small and the tomatoe was not ready to be served.  In retrospect the food was the focus of the need for improvment.  Good beer selection and availability.

dvVSqzSH3QYD9Mul5Yv-fg.text: Great beer selection on tap, the monk quesadilla is the best quesadilla I've ever had. there's a reason this place is always packed. Good food good beer and lots of tvs for sporting events . Bartenders and waitresses are always super friendly making this place a must stop for anyone in the area especially during game day.  Shout out to Gidi in the back whipping up daily dope food specials that always hit the spot with a cold IPA.

Ou0qfRRUfrM1ll8Ira9SAQ.text: TIme for an update -  The Hungry Monk is still awesome!    I have been here several times now and I have never been disappointed.  Most recently I dropped in for lunch on a Wednesday and found out that it was my lucky day!  They offer $3 craft beers all day on Wednesdays!  I had my favorite chicken pita and tried Nitro Stout.  It was delicious.  I know the place gets pretty packed when there are games on.  This time last year I wanted to watch some baseball during the playoffs and walked in to find the place was packed to the rafters with people waiting.  Good for your Hungry Monk!!

1Zk9Ps7ojSWf-V8Mnbvuhw.text: Love this place. I just moved to Chandler from MA and was worried I would not find a good craft beer place in the area. I was so completely wrong! I love how casual this place is, and how friendly the staff AND patrons are. They are constantly changing the beer menu, and everyone who works there is pretty knowledgeable about their selection. They have good deals (like 3$ craft draft beers on wednesdays). I love how I can bring my dog to the bar and sit at the patio, they always bring out a big water bowl full of ice water for her too! The food is OK, nothing to freak out about.. but also nothing to complain about. Just wish they had some healthier/lighter options.. But it is pretty in line with typical bar food.

_g_pTybd9bcYiDypeGQRmg.text: Walked in and walked out. Ten pm half tables have chairs up. Country music and no one greater us.

MQNZzEJ1sCEbGHW0AfTt-Q.text: "Please seat yourself". Went in for a quick lunch break. Not very busy at all. Sat down and nothing. Nobody. 5 minutes later - still crickets. Left and am eating at Denny's next door.

BprXl0whnXIVUV-728IbAQ.text: My new favorite wings place! I've been a fan of the Chandler Teakwoods wings, but these blow them away. On separate visits to The Hungry Monk, my wings were delicious and super crispy. This tells me that they are conscientious about the process by which they fry their wings to a perfect texture. Nothing disappoints me more than a soggy wing!  The other great thing about The Hungry Monk is the beer selection. I visited during Arizona Beer Week (February 19th - 26th, 2011) and was lucky enough to score a free pint glass and samples from San Diego's Ballast Point Brewing Company. The Ballast Point sampler of four beers I ordered were completely original, including a porter infused with coffee and vanilla and a Scottish strong ale aged in whiskey barrels. My buddies and I also indulged in some of The Hungry Monk's half-and-half draft beers which are mixes of their house beers on tap. The names are fun... when you mix half Rogue's Dead Guy Ale with half Stone Brewery's Arrogant Bastard, you get "Dead Bastard".  I cannot rave enough about the Thai Peanut sauced wings. Ordering them just "hot" (2 out of 4 on their spiciness scale) is plenty piquant to get your taste buds fired up. Not as big of a fan of the Cajun-spiced wing which, although flavorful, was a bit too salty for me.  And although I wouldn't mix these two beers deliberately, a stiff salute to whomever came up with the name for the half-n-half SanTan's Epicenter plus Deschute's Black Butte Porter: "The J-Lo". Epic booty indeed!

jmdDLgKY8c_u4tJC6I6_BQ.text: This place was not what I thought it would be.  Frozen Costco pretzels and the slowest service I have had in a while.  Not someplace I will give a second chance to. Surprised they are expanding to a food truck, if they try to compete with the good trucks they will not do well, this food was so far under sub par! We joked about going to Denny's next door, maybe we should have!  And everything from the table, seats to the menus felt dirty!

glHFZvMdvUsI3tM4RnUakw.text: Love, love, love the beer selection! I also really appreciate the fact that they take the time to create a beer menu with so much more detail than just the name.  You can see what style, the brewer and even the alcohol content of each beer before ordering.  We popped in on the 4th of July to grab a bite and a drink.  The Pub Pretzels were soft, and the mustard and cheese were a perfect compliment to the San Tan Epicenter I was drinking.    The chicken tenders were breaded and had that nice crunch, and with the addition of the honey hot wing sauce, were a real treat.  Despite being busy, and apparently low on staff, our service was fast and very friendly.   Misters kept the patio area pleasant, and we were able to hear the fireworks, even if we couldn't see them.

ooEPzAafUKRUUF9ngTmavA.text: This has become our favorite place in town! Great food, large, changing varieties of craft beers, and the service is always, and I mean ALWAYS super! Go once and you'll go again, and again!

1rT5xb5O9VBBOHxykPwdXw.text: the place was ok i got a burger my wife had a Gyro the burger was a little over done the homemade chips that came with were really good but the burger put a damper on the whole meal. My wife's Gyro was good the chips also good, my son had a grilled cheese which was good as well. I would give 3.5 stars if possible, one drawback i did not enjoy was the community tables we generally will not do booths because we need a high chair for our son and usually that could block servers or other people in general but at a community table i really dont want to hear other peoples conversations that i do not know when i am trying to speak to my wife and son. Beer selection was pretty good to, we may give another try

CjqXG1wXTvkaL5H5aKmWhA.text: Decided to try this place out because it's close to our new house and had fairly good reviews.   The Good- the food! Not your typical "bar menu." They offer a wide variety of creative options, at very good prices. We split an order of wings, half a greek quesadilla, and a sandwich. The wings were unbelievable! The rest of our choices were good- and the side of fries were seasoned perfectly. Our service was amazing, too! We sat on the patio, which was pretty empty and I was concerned we'd be ignored or forgotten about...but we were checked on every 10 minutes or so, our food arrived quickly, and our server was incredibly friendly.   The Bad- we sat on the patio (our choice), which was very small. We did so to have some peace and quiet because the bar area was so loud when we walked in. However, people came out to smoke every 10 minutes or so. Which given the space, meant they were blowing smoke all around us.   All in all, I'd come back. This is a neighborhood spot with a good sized bar area. Not a place I'd pick for a cozy date night...but we'll definitely be back for the good eats.

f1Nhy4PU3Ew1m20DshO3Zw.text: This place was reasonably priced, and had very good sports-bar food, along with a great selection of beers. I went with a group of 3, and we all enjoyed our meals. I recommend the Mediterranean Gyro.  The service was well above average for a sports bar, and the food / atmosphere were better. (We went during the NCAA Championship)  I will probably eat here again when I'm back in town.

p09cBePYiZycR1TcXlys3w.text: Last of three stops over a weekend visiting with family. Cool thing was this spot just happened to be about two blocks from my cousins mom's place, so he could actually leave his kids (their grandkids) with them, walk over there for a pint on a Sunday or Saturday to watch a game, then walk back. He had no idea this spot was here, since I guess the last spot had a much more limited menu, and not nearly as many taps.   We visited with a group of 4, that swelled to 9 when word got out just how close this spot was to the family. It was a Sunday evening, so pretty sparse crowd, so we kind of had the run of the place (but we all had Monday off, so was cool for us) Sports bar, few T.V.s booths, not too much as far as Ambiance goes, no real swag or art work that stood out to me. Didnt try the food, but the tap selection was pretty decent, with some local brews on tap, west coast stuff from California (nothing special for me, but great for the locals) I was most interested in the Left Hand offerings, as they don't distribute to Cali.   The Bartender was friendly, and she had pretty good knowledge of the beers they had on tap. Great that the scene in Arizona is growing, welcome site.

wiwAM3LUBhKOfDzf1tbfCA.text: I went here for a happy hour with co-workers after my 6:30-3:00 pm shift ended.  I was really happy I got to experience my only happy hour with the co-workers I went with here at the Hungry Monk.  They have such a gigantic beer selection here and the appetizers are phenomenal.  We were all able to get our food and alcohol at the same time fairly quickly.  In addition, the server was very friendly.

kXHE-hZaB9gOHawjbmraPA.text: Go to place for very large and wide selection of craft beers on tap.  Has good wings as well (use to be called Wings N Rings or something like that, This a far better name :-) )  Some days all beers are $3 which is not bad for some of the really tasty ones.  Sports bar kinda vibe, relaxed overall

75yUbNL8bCuh7DrtrNjwug.text: This is a sports bar, first and foremost, in spite of the name change.  Look around and you see Football jersey folks yelling at the TV during a game, drinking Blue Moon and Dos Equis, chowing down copious amounts of wings, potato chips, burgers, and such.  Now they do have far more beers than usual, though their lengthy menu is a bit disingenuous with their inclusion of blended beers on the list (yes, they'll mix two beers for you, call it something, and put it on the list as another draft beer).  A place can call itself what it wants, but when it lays the bait for a certain demographic by having so many large TV's with obnoxiously loud volumes for sports, they've thereby placed themselves into a niche.  Parking was tough being adjacent to a Denny's, and no parking on west side of building.  Servers were friendly but not always there when needed.  Food and drink prices were high if you're paying normal prices, but the varying happy hour deals were decent deals.  Food wasn't bad, but wasn't great either.  Chips are served with warm BBQ sauce in styrofoam cups which I thought was odd, but maybe I'm being too judgmental, for it is a sports bar.  Overall middle of the road, 3 stars = "Ok".

O_fXnIEkEaVAvbLmrV0rKw.text: One of the best watering holes in chandler with an awesome beer selection.   Food has gotten much much better.   This review has been edited and years back i rated the food as just blah.   It has made a complete 180 and if you were initially turned off by the food before, give it another try.

AZ_O6o-De0uOTtB-aH_GTg.text: I really want to like this place. The food is great, the location isn't bad. What is bad however is the staff. I've been here all of twice, having given it a second chance from our first mishap, and I can say that I honestly wish I hadn't. We came in, was seated, and our drink orders were taken. And then for a good half hour our waitress was MIA. Gone completely. The other waitress just ignored us. Now I understand zones and all of the like, but when you have two obviously upset people needing your attention... you should PROBABLY help them. Then, just as I'm about to say screw it and leave, our waitress returns! "I'm sorry I was handling something in the back." YEAH RIGHT! She smelled like cigarettes and had obviously just got off her break. I don't mind if you go on break! Maybe just take our orders first? I don't think I'll ever be coming back here again.

vHWUd_EtJENGw3xhEUof6A.text: Went here Saturday night with friends.  The wings were fantastic!  The beer selection although a bit pricey was grand.  Live trivia was pretty fun and seemed like everyone in the bar was playing along.  Our server Mike was on top of it, never a dry glass among our party.  So glad we decided to listen to the reviews here and check it out.  We will definitely go back again and again.  Thanks to you all!

SYYVJiaJ7ON0YGHzPkFGhw.text: Great wings, big selection of beer. A bit hard to dig thru their beer selection menu, and some weak areas in the selection, but overall enjoyable and worth the trip.

3Wuecop0efewMUS8F_JQKQ.text: Great beer selection staff is great however the food need's a lot of help it's subpar at best your better off going next door to denny's  then drinking

PkzYG60GdumgXiuk-d6bjw.text: Came in for lunch. Enjoyed Kiltlifter and King James craft brews. The wait staff was friendly and helpful. Busy place with a nice bar. Lots if TVs to watch sports. But not too noisy. Gyro was very good along with the sweet potato fries. Good food, good beer and friendly staff. I like it!

mHC7Pd7AMqdhNlcVNKH9_Q.text: The Pros: -excellent meat in the pulled pork sandwich! -incredible sauce with the sandwich -fantastic, obscure beers on top selection!!! -good service  The Cons: -The bun, the iceberg lettuce and the tomato with the sandwich  I'd normally rate a place like this 3 stars, but I'm giving it a +1 specifically because of their amazing selection of rotating taps.  I like knowing that every time I go in, there will be new surprises on tap.

pIk8unhJALu-UC_7nqR5Zg.text: We have gone here many times for trivia and have never encountered an issue.  This past weekend, we were shown such utter disrespect.  I called ahead to see if we could reserve a low top table as we have a person in our party in a wheelchair (we have done this there before and it was never an issue).  They took down my name and number and said ok.  Then when we arrived, we were told they don't do reservations.  We asked to speak to a manager who came out and told us he had called me back to tell me no (I received no such call) and proceeded to YELL at my boyfriend in the wheelchair about how busy they were and he should know we don't take reservations and why (as he pointed around).  My bf calmly explained we had before and the manager YELLED some more about the other managers causing problems for him by doing such things.  Anyone in a management role should be able to control their effing temper - we were not yelling at him and there is NO reason to get in a handicap person's face and yell like that.  SO EFFING RUDE!!!

KwYcW1f7izgYkArRwM7pjA.text: Love this place! Me and my buddies always come here on Wednesdays. Service is always on point, food is delicious and decently priced.

AmKb1gm5fYzaD3G7BcP0sg.text: Just a quick update to note here.  I was at the Hungry Monk last week and had my choice of 12 different IPAs On Tap.  My God Man!  Hop Head Heaven!!!

njoXnWAxPoaFRiUufTWdpA.text: Too many beers to possibly drink in a whole year. A beer for any mood you are in. The food is ok, but whatever is lacking the selection on tap makes up for. Great and quaint establishment that is never too crowded. Friendly service and a great local bar feel.

uooPAmqrnXKOdytDPew38g.text: Great food and beer. Staff is extremely friendly and is very willing to help you choose a great beer from their huge selection.

rxaLJCWIyXRU99dVQJt8qQ.text: I had the nachos with chilli.  A very large portion.   A good meal.  Hungry Monk is awesome because of the large selection of Draft beers.  Even a beer from a tiny brewery in my area of Pine Arizona (That Brewery).  I am impressed.  Typical bar set up.  Good service.   Took a bit to get silverware,  yet a fun place to hang out.  I will be back.

SyTvShM3srOyr4qtLVkOww.text: This is by far my favorite place in Chandler. I started out here alone before my wife could join me, the bartenders and regulars make for good conversation, but the best part about here is the beer. The food isn't bad either just nothing to write home about.

mh_KPagNkjhep62m3wvNRA.text: Food is okay but, good luck getting service!

wtW3FhKeV6FyzpO-eotp8g.text: Good place to hang out with friends . The foods was amazing and the service was great. Will be back soon but dont wanna gain to much weught.

MHeRA4subGSq6rJnbAzuXw.text: I want to love this place, but every time I order something to go, when I get it home it's not what I ordered! Tthe people are nice enough, but seem to never get my order right.  The wings that I ordered were just ok this last time, and I'm sort of wondering now if they microwaved as the wings were a little tuff.

U6PJsAPFC-zCMvg5WxqOxA.text: I stopped in for lunch and found their lunch special to be a great value. The Hungry Monk is on my approved list of establishments for a good lunch without breaking the bank. I really like their home made chips and the Gyro sandwich is pretty good too.

YDfMm2HgJSjvcipXH-DFkg.text: What a great spot! We did #evfn here last Friday on the suggestion of one of our attendees. Mike and his crew treated us right the whole way!  Food: well... I didn't eat that night. Not that it didn't look fantastic. The Sloppy Fries look like something I could sleep in. The burgers were massive. And every table that had wings didn't talk until they were devoured. I'd say that was a positive.  Beer: GODS! Any place that keeps Arrogant Bastard on tap is going to get bonus points from me. But they've got a great tap selection of local craft brews and national favorites. Discriminating beer drinkers -- that would be me -- will not be disappointed.   I'll be back!

8LRc5VezZdDn0CGfZd-EZg.text: My daughter and I are always looking for dog-friendly restaurants wherever we go. We were in Chandler this weekend and first ate at San Tan's Brewery (great place! And we were able to bring Max, our mini-Schnauzer), since we were staying at the Crowne Plaza San Marcos Resort). Then we went to the Hungry Monk for our dinner the following night. We sat outside on the patio. It was 102 outside by 8:30 but the misters were going strong. Ordered the shrimp bowl over steamed rice with Thai Peanut sauce (it was just ok). But my daughter loved the Gyro pita that she ordered. 4 stars for the friendly ambiance and for being dog-friendly.

oIfX_5ugwaeWQOGBH_s8fg.text: We go there every chance we get.  A little bit of a drive for us but a family favorite.  Best wings in town and LOVE the Abby Chips.  (A MUST!)  Only reason there is not 5 stars is sometimes it is so crowded (good for business but not for customers), it is hard to get a seat.

ooayyiVMhxfuNHF5A7e9Ng.text: This place seems hit or miss to me.  Typically, there is a great beer selection on tap...no complaints there.  As far as the food and service goes? Well that's a different story in my opinion.  Without going into too much detail, the dining area could be a bit cleaner more consistently, the wait staff could be a bit more attentive and friendly, and the food could be more consistent.  Not a bad place at all, especially if beer is your main concern.

UUr0pbCAozgqqcqdh0f2MA.text: Come on in, sit down at a community table, make new friends, have a delicious beer & enjoy any of the amazing beer-friendly menu items.  The Sriracha Bacon Brussels & Buffalo'd Cauliflower (with the house made blue cheese) are to die for!

7-qytcTTNGO-_tDHa1-EPw.text: We came on a Tuesday night because we knew they had wing night. Great deal on the wings and the happy hour drinks. Will be back for sure! The wings we had were bone in and most seem fried then sauced so they are very crispy but not dried out. I loved the Thai Peanut sauce and will go back for that. My daughter had a burger and fries which was cooked right and tasted good. Our server was really busy- Tuesday's also apparently trivia night and the place was packed by the time we left. But the service was still excellent and our drinks were always full. Will be visiting again!

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wing night

SCA0qr6gZPzc6dWE_TIPIA.text: The service here is absolutely horrible. We TRIED to eat on the patio and had a HORRIBLE experience. We used to frequent here regularly but as of late have just stayed away. Wanna eat inside because you dont like the smell of cigarette smoke? Too bad the smoke from the patio shoots inside everytime a waitress decides to leave the door open. Wanna sit in a booth? Good luck they all have holes and missing padding and shake and rock everytime you shift your weight. Wanna beer? Takes about 20 mins average for the waitress to put in your first drink, AT THE BAR, nevermind when youre sitting at a table. Wanna eat on the patio with your 7 pound dog like you did the two times before? Too bad the rules change per waitress. Doesnt matter that they seated you and got your drinks, you and your dog are gone! Want a waitress that will return to the table at least once before your food arrives, you know, incase you want another beer? Nope not gonna happen.   See all these complaints? I never once brought a single one of the them to the attention of the owner/manager. He was there when we were kicked off the patio and watched the whole thing go down. There reviews plummet week by week, sign of the times.

gGblihEIpcMcVbjlcNtLjQ.text: Ordered grilled chicken and it came to me cold and soggy had it heated and then it came to me burnt. My friends hamburger sliders were still a little pink. Felt really bad for the waiter since it wasn't he's fault for the cooks messing up our food. I am honestly giving a bad review mostly because I was approached by like 5 different employees about my messed up order and I was starving took about an 1 half to get 3 grilled chicken strips to me

6pecfwkaUZQW4sRkOs9J7w.text: Went there for the first time and the service and food was fantastic.  The beer selection was out of this world!  Literally they had beers from all over the world.  The wings were great and the veggies made you want to forget the wings and just eat your brussel sprouts and cauliflower; it would make your Mom happy.

eRYQyTVVVyoNP_xUPB0Jpg.text: So hello all i'm in Chandler Arizona! First this place has a very cool personality of it's own.  Just got a flight of 6 beers IPA'S LOL of course. Picture you will see. The menu is awesome. Met the chef I think but ordered my usual. Wings. Great choices. First you order how many than the sauce than the heat level. Well today I did Thai Peanut extra hot,  than brewtus extra hot. 10 total. I also tsaf told that the fish n chips are too dire for here I will be back to tell you about that next week. Ok so back to the flight first was the brewtus IPA. YEAH ROCK ON!  2nd Union zJack American IPA. It's good not my goto but tasty nonetheless. Next HopKnot a West Coast IPA. Very good. Ok so he ate my wings. Stellar! Amazing! Perfectly cooked! My God! 10 across the boards! 2 Hearted American IPA. Amazing! I'm gonna stop for a second....... this place is like a family bar, meaning good people. Real good people and wonderful atmosphere! To the owner BRAVO! Back to the beers lol. Odell Drumroll. Ok. Missing something lol. Light beer. Finally Sierra Nevada Pesiliana. Wow try it! This place looked by bartender Mark thank you! People come here eat drink and enjoy! You will not be disappointed! Take care all! 10 Stars! ROCK ON HUNGRY MONK!

Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States

PCNwZcvVHV_K3QpBDiZ7dA.text: Disappointed yet again. This place is right up the street so we keep trying to like them but pretty much every other visit lets us down. Just walked out (party of two)

pwXvmHcTB75w-tYFTjGIDQ.text: Not so sure, but the manager was really great! He saw the big group coming in with money and was very good to us!

Cy3hjoh2lwrn1QDdTgTFNA.text: Came here for the first time today and was very impressed. My buddy and I sat at the bar and were immediately assisted. The bartender's a sweetheart. She took our order right away and it was out in 10-15 minutes.  The manager came out and joked with us. Nice guy! The wait wasn't bad because the food was made fresh. I ordered the bone in wings: 5 medium buffalo and the 5 sweet BBQ. Wings tasted way better than they look as the homemade sauces are delicious, and wings are cooked just right. The seasoned wings were perfection! I'll compare to Jack in the Box/Arby's curly fries but better and healthier because they don't use the same ingredients as the fast food giants do. My friend loved his honey hot wings and the huge onion rings, too. He made a comment that he's going to be coming back a lot! We will definitely come back and use the punch card to get to a free meal. This place rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Wings and fries
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Beer on draft.
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Churro dessert

zqujVVk75mI9G4qmjd4Opw.text: Pretty good for a sports bar. Good selections on the food menu. Great craft beer list and decor is simple but does the trick. Food was also good and well prepared. Not in this area very often but will keep it in mind if we are again.

Lhac3coxHygSz9SxvfH1DQ.text: To be honest ma food was so bad I wanted to leave but ma granpets like where food but the French fries were delicious

EH-NtGX9fqugO92plP1nRQ.text: Great local place! The food and beer is always good. The beer selection is awesome. Prices can't be beat.

736m0LbxDKOZfKdcQtE7gQ.text: I'm so impressed by this place on a Saturday night. I had a wonderful experience! It was definitely a different atmosphere.   They changed the menu slightly but kept the to-die-for buffalo cauliflower wings.   I'm thrilled that the first time was just a fluke. The bartenders were so nice and attentive. All of the baseball games were on and they're open to changing it to your team if no one else is watching it.   The Bloody Mary was perfect! I forgot to ask for it spicy but she had the perfect amount of kick in there.

5_XI2bxksc1tM4BqpGcv2w.text: They have the best chicken tenders I've ever had in my life. If you choose to dip them in their home made blue cheese dressing you're getting a taste of heaven! I also had the Siracha Brussels Sprout - OMG they're to die for. Great meal!!

FcCXoHwcGQIDv5m-C_v6hA.text: All hail the Hungry Monk!!! Work dropped me in the area and hunger and Yelp delivered me to the Hungry Monk.  Tons of beer on tap and tons of tv's to keep you engaged. After looking at the menu I came across the Hungry Monk Trippel. One of the easiest decisions I have made.  The sandwich is stacked with  smoked pulled pork, Applewood bacon & a thick slab of grilled ham. It is served on grilled sourdough. It also comes w/ a side of Freddie G's gourmet BBQ sauce. Apparently Freddie G is a local BBQ legend. It is tangy with a hint of sweet. The sandwich is awesome. It is pork personified and is worth whatever caloric bomb that detonates. The sauce is crucial as the pork three ways can be too salty, you need the contrast.   Great beer, great ambience, and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Monk Trippel
Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Monk Trippel

wq_gRSQBCtkG0aD2mKcOWQ.text: Really like it here, they have a couple trivia nights a week that get pretty competitive. The beer on draft has a wide selection, the wings are awesome, and the prices are really great with the daily specials. The staff is also super friendly. My new favorite hangout bar. 2 thumbs up!

VCikE1xUeK1axMXp_YdvVA.text: Our to go order was wrong, and of course I didn't realize until we got home. Manager was super apologetic, and went above and beyond to make it right.

a8dm1g9dPqs-icOIM3PtFg.text: This place was... well... meh. I probably would have rated it higher were it not for the level of disappointment that I experienced. Everything was fine, but it wasn't any better than that. Standard pub fare, but the way that they advertised themselves it seemed like it would be a more... I dunno... "deep" experience. They pride themselves on their tap selections, but really there's little here that you can't find at your average 24/7 Walmart. When Rampant is your highest ABV beer, I don't think you have the right to put the word 'Monk' in your name.   The burger that I had was fine. The extremely porky sandwich that my brother had was fine. Everything was fine, but that's it. And honestly, I can do much better at home with a 4-pack of tasty Belgian beers and some good delivery food.

WT7h1f4nIYkLPrLreV_q5g.text: Our new fave spot for dinner!! Tuesday is trivia plus 65 cent wings. Try the jerk flavor. So delicious!! The buffalo cauliflower is my favorite appetizer. Well, that and the grilled Brussels sprouts. So much tasty food and fun atmosphere.

Va6KVZgGhdKtsmSGb7LXaw.text: Sorry Giddy,  the worst Philly Steak Sandwich ever. Soggy tasteless roll, meat had a sweet taste not Philly maybe Havana lol. $11.00 where's the peperchinni. Come on Man?

3vzl0uMoqqb39e8GbImbng.text: A large beer list and food list. Full kitchen opened till 11 on a Sunday...that's so rare in chandler! Friendly staff and a ton of tv's! I love this place.

DNRhtf6Ry-x9a_33yHeecA.text: I have been here a few times, and each time the food always has been good! This past Friday, my partner and I were in the mood for some good wings and the reviews on their wings here drew us there. We went on a Friday night after we saw a movie. I like that this place is not too big, but very comfortable and awesome atmosphere. They do have an awesome selection of beers and a good menu. It is bar food for sure, but delicious.   We both had an order of 10 bone in wings, regular buffalo and were nice and tangy, the way we like it. Next time I am going to try a little hotter. The wings were cooked perfectly. Crispy on the outside, nice and hot on the inside. The ranch, DELICIOUS. Blue Cheese, good but not my favorite. I prefer other blends, but I know some people will like it. It's just my personal preference that I didn't enjoy it as much as others.   We also split their version of a pub salad. It was huge and perfect to It's split. Fresh ingredients! We enjoyed that very much.   I did not let our service affect our rating, but when we went, the server wasn't the most friendly. Was not warm and welcoming at all. Kinda rude in the beginning but he changed up his attitude and got better. Everyone has an off day so I don't want to let the service affect my rating because we WILL go back.   It is nice to have a "hole the wall" type bar close to home. We are not sports fans, but we like the people and atmosphere, beer and food. just overall a neat place and look forward to going back!

8LfbxoC4nrJnauvjOBbYQg.text: Just the worst food I have ever had in AZ. the pickle spears are super salty and oily due to the amount of dough used to fry it. Had 3 kids with me that ordered a soup, a bacon cheeseburger, and a sandwich. You would think its Hard to mess up a bacon burger but apparently it's not. The food was so bad, the kids refused to finish it. One child went to the bathroom and got sick from the soup. I wish I could say something positive but I just can't. Sorry. Just don't go here. You will be disappointed if getting anything other than beer.

8zowVsUHkCF9dr6nG8tGWw.text: Mediocre. We went on a late Friday night and it was the typical greasy, fried bar food. If you're going to watch a game and drink a beer then this satisfies. They have lots of beers on tap.

HPH8DC9gE28e3iI3QappYg.text: The combo of your fried pickles & "tiff's fav" is enough to make a girl afraid she might be pregnant.

4ppvxQburEKbcXkL8FJHIA.text: Felt it was a greasy pit of processed food.  Really let down with all the other reviews i read... it was nothing what others described.

FmuP1W7RyN6_AijJghFFQw.text: Okay beer pub, not too many alternative options in the vicinity.  Not the "best" beer selection, but it is drinkable. The atmosphere could be a bit more welcoming.

9Z__PvQM4v8ZNkHeEJkoFA.text: One of our favorite go to places to grab a quick meal before a movie. The food is amazing. Lots of TVs with a variety of sports, but the music is a little too loud for conversation with your table.

NvGRQ_q1v9dXdbGBcbfzyQ.text: Great deal on Mondays for all you can eat boneless wings. The wings are a lot better quality then most competitors. Lots of tv's to watch the games and a large beer selection. Servers are very nice but sometimes they seemed under staffed. Overall pretty awesome place for Monday night football, wings, and beer.

yzv3gGzjR9xHd7107Fxy4g.text: Stopped in for lunch on Friday and was so disappointed. Our food came out Luke warm at best. My burger had no flavor and was probably a frozen party. First and last time I'll step foot in The Hungry Monk.

k-QHdKyERXJ-W6o9cLTnJQ.text: If you're looking for gourmet food or white glove service...then obviously this isn't your place. BUT if you are looking for a fantastic local neighborhood bar with tons of tv's for sports, awesome beer list that changes regularly and delicious wings I highly recommend.

NCb4nNDk0cZvmsemu13KnA.text: My wife and I go here about once a month and have never been disappointed.  For happy hour we had the house wines.  Those wine glasses have generous portions and are only $4 each.   Happy hour wines at many places are hit or miss for decent quality.  We liked ours.  We were light eaters yesterday (July 9, 2014) so we only ordered the chips & salsa for $3 or $4 & the chicken quesadilla for $5.  The salsa is a wee bit spicy but we liked it.  We saw quite a few families with small children.  It looked like moms & dads just getting off work and taking the family out for a bite.  Just about every seat has numerous TVs to watch.  Usually, at least one of the TVs is audible but last night the volume controls must have been cranked down on all of them.  The table next to us looked like a young couple on their first date.  So, I would say that the crowd is pretty well represented demographically.  I do not recall what time Happy Hour begins but it ends at 7:00.    We travel a great deal and are always on the lookout for places where the locals frequent.  This is such a place.

iqRmrZodi4aUHuvjbq1v5w.text: I can only, barely give one star, as this is the lowest rating available. The establishment reeks of old cheese and sweat. The service is, well, let's say it needs improvement. We only chose to be here because Santan Brewery was hosting a Fiesta Night. It was gross and the menu needs help. We visit many similar establishments and this, by far, is one that we will not revisit.

u07DwY2JhtPSsyqojajgsg.text: Good food.  Great beer.   But booo for not filling growlers.   What's the point of having an amazing beer selection and then not fill a growler???

3AQ2Pn8gOk_j23CjCTSmEw.text: AWESOME happy hour spot. They have a huge selection of $3 happy hour beers. The service is amazing! I ordered some cheese quesadillas and they were quite tasty. I will definitely go back here.

-2EQ1H6SsWYyN-TjQswYbQ.text: As a bar the place isn't bad. They have tons of different beers and different offers during the week. I have been going here for almost a year every week and I have to say the place has gone down the tubes. Since I'm not 21 yet I can't really enjoy the beer. I came for the food. They used to have good portions for a good price. The Quesadilla, gyro, and burger were the best, but over the last couple of months, they've jacked up there prices and have made the portions smaller. Also every time I've gotten the burger recently, I've had to send it back because they overcooked it. My dad ordered his medium and I ordered mine medium rare. They were both overcooked. This has happened multiple times. A lot of the servers are not as friendly. There not mean, they just don't seem to have the time of day to say "hi, how are you?". Also a lot of the new servers are barely 18 and have no knowledge of the beer menu if that's what your there for. Even though it's a bar,it can get really overcrowded and really loud. I wouldn't go here for dinner anymore because it's too crazy in there. Other than that, the only food that is still pretty good for the price is he gyro. Even that's getting expensive.

e13d6ty4d5IeDoSQNz10wg.text: Great people. Creative food. Cool neighborhood bar. Wouldn't hurt them to have Warsteiner on more often!

ZwBH406B7sZ56y6Y2kEcsw.text: After walking out of a nearby sports grill named for a former Phoenix Suns player due to a lack of service I happened upon the Hungry Monk. The menu was full of great choices and included a separate craft beer menu that will make even the most novice beer drinkers excited to experiment. The burger I ordered was great... cooked perfectly and arriving quickly even with a packed house. The servers were fast and friendly, worked as a team making it a great experience.

Oh2jcZNUneW7FDfhWPZf-Q.text: So good! I has the grilled cheese, and pretzel sticks.  They were both amazing!  Definitely recommend this place!

l53E5VzZSJi1emEFldM4QQ.text: I went to this place on a recommendation.  I was told this place dishes up the best bar food in the valley along with a plethora of brews on tap.  Well, the tipster is batting .500.  This place had a ton of great brews, and a nifty laminated list with descriptions, alc%, and brew styles that made it easy to pick a perfect beer. However, the food was pretty sub par.  The wings were ok, but not the best.  The bleu burger was somehow salty and flavorless.  French fries we also nothing to write home about.  I thought maybe it was a busy night, and a small sample size for an impression.  The next day i picked up some fish and chips, and a Reuben for myself and my lover.  The fish was extremely bland and greasy.  The Rueben was equally unimpressive; Lots of meat but the rye bread didn't seem all too fresh and the onions were few and far between.  Nice atmosphere and helpful wait staff.  Even though the place was bumpin' on a Saturday night, all my drink/food requests were handled in a timely manner.  The staff great advice on which beers to indulge in.  Was also notified that the owner rotates beers on a somewhat weekly basis which is refreshing.  I will go back again, but i will lower my expectations for the food.

Id7r4dD0e-Sl4gsEPiJtiA.text: The Monk has really upped their game when it comes to food in the past couple of years.  The addition of the pork cracklings app ($8) has drawn us pork junkies back time and time again.  Should I even mention the Hungry Monk trippel sandwich with pork three ways?  It has always been delicious and goes well with a good beer.  Their burgers have also improved immensely since my last review.    The side I recommend is their house made Abbey chips.  Go all in with the magical pig and you won't be disappointed.  They continue to have a great beer selection and the staff is friendly too.  Hungry Monk is a fantastic neighborhood bar.

u2cDG0QrpkCYpzOZFfmv9A.text: OH.MY.GOODNESS. GREAT food. I could have kept eating if my stomach allowed me to. Also, their beer and drinks selection is very good. This spot is perfect for simple get-togethers and well-priced. We had a pretty sizable group (approx. 15 people that trickled in); I do wish the waiter made more of an effort to accommodate. Instead of letting us join tables together we had two split tables. It was unfortunate when the first table maxed out and there was two people at the second table until everyone else showed up LOL Overall though, we had a great time - I would definitely go back.

Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States

Bz9Arq-rp71IXJsImD7zhg.text: This is a bar with an extensive selection of beer. They also have lunch specials under $10. Service is friendly and adequate.

Lhx7dS8LnydQi2IMkFAuNA.text: One of our colleague suggested to go get some lunch from this place. Though it was a bar food we agreed coz they said the food was good, which is not always the case with bars.  The place had good amount of people for a Friday lunch, we were a group of 11 and were seated together. The place is a typical bar atmosphere with big screens, lot of booth seating and open bars.  We ordered the food, my first thought after looking at the menu was the steep high prices. The burgers were averaged around $12. I ordered some chicken wings and chicken quesadilla, The chicken wings, I went with garlic rub and they weren't that great. I was not very happy with the wings.  The chicken quesadilla had raw tomatoes inside and wasn't that good either. The service was awfully slow. I get it we were a group of 11 but getting the check and payment took forever too.  Overall not my kind of place, I might not come back. Food was definitely average for the prices they have. It's definitely on the expensive side. May be the drinks are pretty good, but can't comment yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken quesadilla

tTXVbvwKTljkQusRHFnLzg.text: First time visit and really enjoyed the vibe, cool atmosphere, sport bar feeling, with a great waitress and good food. Had the All You Can Eat Friday Fish and Chips. Two pieces of fish each time you request another basket. Fries were good but cole slaw was lacking in flavor. Packed house so a good sign for Friday night fish fry.   Try it... you'll like it.

7RMh45k8Q8LNoPu1qWJEBw.text: Wasn't impressed looks like it would be a great place to have a beverage but I wouldnt  necessarily go there specifically to eat maybe I shouldn't have ordered fried food should have ordered something a little less greasy so it could have been what I ordered that altered my opinion but it's mainly bar type food so I wouldn't necessarily consider it a meal maybe after a meal if you go have a drink and you need something greasy to soak up the alcohol then this would  be fantastic but other than that yeah it's not really a family type environment more of a bar I guess maybe my interpretation of what it was may have altered my view of what it should have been but still good friendly staff awesome people

GP6RSJmMhwmkljSsW_MAaA.text: They have pretty good food but our waiter ruined the experience.  It wasn't that busy but he looked lost and was extremely slow.  They brought another tables food to our table 3 times!  After a long wait, we finally got OUR food.  We had the pretzels sticks for an app, their beer cheese is interesting and unique but pretty good.  Then we got the chicken strips, both grilled and fried, which were good and descent sized.  We also split a half order ( which was plenty) of the homemade kettle chips.    Would of gave four stars but the wait to get everything brought it down.  Maybe it was just a bad night!?!?

Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Homemade chips with bbq.  Delicious!

UiZ4MnqcI0giNdxGOzhqqg.text: I'm impressed. I mean it's a rip off of a "restaurant where the women are all servers and bartenders and where tank tops and tight fitting jeans, lots of blond pretty females type of establishment".  Industrial sports type atmosphere. Burgers priced about $13 to $14 bucks but they were big. Blue cheese is obviously homemade or a good brand. Very chunky.  Chicken wings are it's draw but they are a bit expensive. I will say the boneless wings were decent size. The mustard hot sauce is very good.  Chicken strips 5 for $10 can be fried or grilled. I thought that was good thinking.  I want to say the chx strips seemed like the portion of two chicken breasts.  House made chips are the bomb. Served with a good bbq sauce.  The pulled pork-ham steak- bacon sandwich was meaty.  Good draught beer list with local beers.  All in all. Impressed and we will be back. We want to try reverse happy hour. Seems good.

xmtm8G_zpSr36aOMq7aRMw.text: Love their food and trivia nights are super fun! Always busy? Though so get there early if you plan to do trivia. Their food isn't typical "bar fare". Their sirrhachi Brussels sprouts are delicious

z0gxNITskQhZguiL7rkt-Q.text: I came here for wings I smacked 15 to myself and wouldn't have had it any other way. The lemon pepper are incredible along with the parmesan garlic. I classic buffalo are classic buffalo and deliver expectations. I do have to say I wasn't the biggest fan of the brewtus sauce it's almost just a basic barbecue nothing special. But great beer selection overall. House made bleu cheese is absolutely incredible. Not a bleu cheese guy but will forsure get that every time I go.

92HGZgzeR5e9IbLdm7CZzA.text: The Monk is still the go-to place for great Chicken. (Oh, and their Bar is pretty well stocked, too).  We've been coming here for over five years and it seems everyone in my office is here on most days.  Yeah, I know that Wild Chicken place at the Mall does some nice business too. But they cannot beat The Monks for flavor, price or size of their chicken tenders.   If you like heat, well The Monk has something called Nuclear. You got to try it. It will make your mouth water and make the top of your head perspire. Now that I just describe it, can you taste it?    Don't forget their $0.65 Wings Tuesday's and $3.00 Craft Beer & $0.65 Boneless Wings - All Day Wednesday!  "Another Hopknot IPA, barkeep."  Enjoy!

29XExoUKG6Uc2Gzp4JoJBw.text: Leaving the same rating, but have now been here more frequently. The service has improved a bit, bit the food quality for the future menu is questionable. I tried the new queso a couple weeks ago and it was good, but tonight it was really bad. They also changed the cheese dip for the pretzels and it was not good. I would like to see more consistency in quality of food and service.

JLbQJueVPrPKD4j7fDwfew.text: Absolutely love this place! My family comes here what seems to be every week! We have had most of the servers and they are all very friendly. The service is quick and they have great specials. Never have a bad experience here. We love the wings and our kids think they have the best mini corn dogs!

h_kxtnbixUbudhsPvx-N-g.text: Every time I hit the Hungry Monk a few things always happen.  First - I meet a lot of cool people I don't know and end up talking to them all night.    Second - the staff there is always laid back and cool but spot on with service.  Lastly - I always seem to hit them when they have some form of special rolling.  Last time it was O.S.H.O's Blueberry beer and we walked out with some cool goods like beer pints and bling.    The beer selection is always solid and while I normally don't eat much when I drink beer, their wings I had last time were very good.  HM is a great bar/restaurant and has great patrons that make the place even better.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Osho blueberry NE style ipa

LTtE3Ityjoc3LK_VA68s_A.text: Good food, nice atmosphere and excellent service! Our server, Heather took excellent care of us, she was very knowledgeable about their menu, tap choices and even though they were pretty busy - she made sure we were always taken care of! We'll be coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. Lots of good choices on tap!

77Mqlvy24cCLtDhMkRgLaA.text: Came in for lunch on a Monday afternoon. We were created right away and given terrific service. My sister and I both had the lunch wing special. The wings are so yummy and the French fries are just the right portion.  Make sure to try the fried mushrooms they are amazing. Both crunchy and juicy at the same time. I would also recommend trying a Bloody Mary. The make the mix in house and it is better than lots of pre made mixes I have had. Will definitely be back.

SucVkgRYtCZ2sdI66z0_HQ.text: Stopped for beers and smart talk. Nice local bar. Didn't eat anything. The decor was the usual Urban brewery look. Nice enough!

6kANBE2ek8yb1po819bVfQ.text: We love this place. They have really delicious French fries and wings. We always start out with mini corn dogs and the honey mustard that comes with it, is amazingly delicious. They had great beer specials that day and the restaurant was clean. The honey hot sauce is my favorite. This really is one of my favorite restaurants to eat at.   I was disappointed the second time we went, it was 8:30 and apparently they close at 9 during the summer. But the bartender didn't let us in. The open sign was still turned on and after she made us leave, she went to turn off the sign. So they turn away sales just to make sure they leave early. Less money in her pocket. So next time I go, I won't be sitting up at the bar because if that.

W_3w01xAqUXHMzmDdBmtwA.text: Decided to give this place a try and I was excited for the fish fry. Their menu appears to have a great happy hour menu. Lots of drink specials and not just well drinks but also name brand Captain, 3 Olives, Jager and more. We ordered the fried pickles on the happy hour menu for $5. They were great probably the best fried pickles I've had. They were just right they never got soggy. They are cut long ways and flat. We did the all you can eat catfish and they give you two large fillets your basically getting an entire catfish. It was good they said it was Cajun but really it was no spicy at all. I enjoyed it. Now here is the rest 3 stars due to service. Our order came and that was it never did we get checked on for drinks or to place another order. The person went to the table next to us and never to us. It was very disappointing. If I ever go back I think I will sit at the bar and hope for a different experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States

1kIJEb8CzEjHNm7jCNsPJQ.text: I have been coming to Hungry Monk for the past couple of years and finally decided to leave a review. First, their beer selection is always on point. They have several beers on tap always, and a great rotating selection. The will provide you a sample of anything to try. They have themed events and beer take overs frequently.   The food is pretty decent. The chicken is alway cooked well, the burgers and juicy, tots and onion rings never disappoint.   During Happy Hour the bar area is packed, so usually end up sitting at a table in the restaurant area, its ok if you have children with you, but if you are looking to avoid kids, the restaurant isnt the pace to sit.

LlKEwW4k-CKm5K2PgL6xXg.text: A couple of glasses of Nitro Milk Stout + a basket of Abby Chips is no better way to end the day.  This place has some great beers.

_yz1SqwwDG0gNdXEc4hmxw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!  First and foremost, the owner and his wife are AWESOME people and are super personable...on the day I came in, he knew about 75% of the people in there by name. That alone says a lot about how much they care about their customers.  The food is awesome! Love the fish and chips, perfectly cooked and FRESH to boot. My dad had the ham and cheese sandwich on a pretzel bun and it was soooo good.  Finally, their beer selection is amazing and their staff is very knowledgeable. I am not a huge beer person myself, but I enjoyed some recommendations given to me, and was also very impressed to see several different types of cider on the menu as well (it was good to venture away from my typical strongbow).  I love the Hungry Monk and strongly recommend it to anyone that likes good food, great beer, and great service. :)

Ws7XBKBr8_fxnNF6sfjwaQ.text: Went here on a saturday service was fine but it was loud and the guests there got really out of hand and no one stopped them. The bathrooms were a wreck. Not what i expected from someplace that looks so nice.

bbbKetZorPsF3VB82PFySA.text: This is a neighborhood gem, for sure.  I've driven by several times and last Saturday I finally made it.  The place took me to happier times when I used to go to neighborhood restaurants with cousins and the kind as a kid.  A non pretentious nice neighborhood place run by a beer lover (nothing wrong with that) with a broad selection of comfort food and beer.  I had the ribs and they were pretty decent. Just don't forget to order extra sauce.  Perfect place for a quick bite or spend a nice time with good company.  Cheers!

b2Y9tq2WZcoDKhM5R-vjrQ.text: The day after the 100-year-flood we had recently I was watching the feed from a TV news helicopter and saw a parking lot that had turned into a giant swimming pool with a bunch of kids on boogie boards. I wondered where the heck this place was until the camera panned out and I caught a glimpse of the Travelling Monk truck. I didn't have to wait for the camera to pan out and confirm it was near Denny's and Hungry Monk to know where this mall was. This is when I realized the Hungry Monk was a landmark. In the month before this happened, Hungry Monk had become a dining and drinking landmark for me and my friends. Tuesdays and Saturdays are trivia nights and we've attended quite a few of those to play against dozens of other teams with raunchy, silly, risque, and downright funny names. I wouldn't say we've been here enough times to be called regulars but Marcie the bartender knows us and that means we come here often enough. Most of the real regulars hang out at the patio smoking cigs and coffin nails and we've never really ventured out that way. Have seen some bizarre stuff right at closing time at the bar - some guy in his 80's motorboating some woman a few decades younger than he was. Then another time some guy offered his girlfriend to some other guy he was bonding with over drinks. Good times, good times! I've tried most of their food and I usually stick with that massive Hungry Monk Trippel - with locally smoked pulled pork, smoked bacon, and a thick slab of grilled tavern ham and served on thick cut Texas Toast with a side of Freddy G's BBQ sauce. They don't give enough sauce for that though. Also the Monk's Ribs is actually pretty decent for bar food. And their gyros. Funny thing, one of my friends started talking to this guy with tattoos that works at Monk and asked him if he was the bouncer. Nope. Turned out he was the chef. LOL. Place gets pretty packed daily around dinner time but usually clears out before it gets late. These guys also have a TouchTunes jukebox but sometimes they have some crappy radio station turned on so you can't use it. Place closes at midnight most days or at 1 AM weekends. But the closing times are like stop signs in Nogales - mostly just suggestions. I've been there when last call ended up way past the regularly scheduled closing time. Their food is decent but if you're still hungry after they close there's always Denny's next door or Los Favoritos not too far away in the mall.

photos.caption: Photo of Hungry Monk - Chandler, AZ, United States. The Hungry Monk Trippel - skip breakfast and lunch first!

1c0FWU3iqLjsM-qEPNqb3w.text: I had arrived late into Phoenix, so I was *starving* by the time I arrived at The Hungry Monk. The place was packed and hopping. I'd read the reviews, and was hopeful this would be a good place to eat.   Ended up getting the bourbon BBQ burger with fries. I had asked for a medium rare burger, on the rarer side. It arrived more medium than anything. Both the burger and fries were decent, nothing to write home about. I was pretty tired, so I wasn't much in the mood for any beer. That kind of defeats the purpose of going to an ale house for dinner, but there you have it.

xcHMhAB887xRmGKaRNsYOw.text: If you like average food at a not so average price, then this is the place for you.  Tried several items in order to get a good look at the place.  Fried pickles were the best item we ordered, with that being said....there wasn't anything special about 'em.  Buffalo'd Cauliflower...sounds cool yes?  Nope.  Sauce was good but overpowered the delicate flavor of the grilled cauliflower and waaaayy  over-dressed.  Pulled pork---boooooring...something you could have gotten at Costco from the freezer section.  Bun/bread overpowered the pork and bbq sauce.  Coleslaw was needed to bring it up a notch was underseasoned and needed vinegar for "pop".  Fish and chips was the last item...well  it was probably the smallest order of greasy fish piled onto the largest pile of french fries we've ever seen.  It was okay.  server was friendly but didn't go out of her way, atmosphere was nice, clean, comfortable....but wow....just missing the mark on the food by a smidge....my beer should/could have been colder...hubbies was correct temp.

odO0ScLBVO9xukL9SsqgDQ.text: Went here with a few friends on a Saturday night and it was pretty awesome. They weren't as crowded as I had expected, though there was a decent amount of people.   Our waiter was super nice, helpful and attentive. They have a nice selection of beer and my friends enjoyed everything they ordered. I had Rum and Diet, which was, of course, delicious and on special!  We had fried pickles, quesadillas, boneless wings and something else. Their menu on the website doesn't work so I can't go refresh my memory. We had the BBQ and Garlic boneless wings and while they didn't look particularly appetizing they were delicious. The fried pickles were a little spicy for me, but I'm a baby when it comes to spicy foods lol. My friend loved his quesadilla.   The only downside is that their barstools are very uncomfortable after a few hours. I would recommend sitting in the regular seating section if you're planning on staying a while.   All in all this place was great and we'll definitely be back!

VW9ulJQotO2YCiI4wWmHxQ.text: Was here for a special event last month. I was really impressed. I had figured it was you basic bar food, and yeah it sort of is. I say sort of because I think its like bar food elevated to the next level. We had a large party and sampled  a wide variety of the menu items, and everyone thought they were great.  The beer menu is vast and impressive. The wait staff was knowledgeable about the beers and also made suggestions. We sample a few specialty shots as well and they were top notch.   I would give the Hungry Monk a full five stars, but the wait staff seemed a little frazzled by our party size and there were a couple of miscommunications as well.   Otherwise it was an outstanding and I wouldn't hesitate to go back!

yku5-Uu7fZjGAY5FC11zGw.text: Great wings, sweet potato fries and funnel dessert thing. Service by Marcy was amazing! :)

Gi-YHgKRtrZoMWkKP2uZcg.text: Try the crazy wings! Add a level of heat and it's even better! The beer list is always fantastic, the service is great and the rest of the food menu is always expanding and delicious, with great specials... Beer and bacon night? Yes please! I've never had anything I've not liked.  One of the best bars in the area. We already come back to this place over and over, and we can't get enough!

cvxlDxTdLlz2F0t-JmS4dA.text: I got to say that I've never had a quote unquote bar that I frequent, but with the staff at the hungry monk, Bailey and Stephanie in particular, I come here at least 3 to 4 times a week, even if its just to grab a quick bite to eat. The food's great and affordable, the beers are always great, even though they do run out occasionally, but overall the experience is always  awesome. I'm glad that I have a bar I can call my own. Kudos!

XNgMbNpC47CqyRWFkLopxQ.text: The mission today was wings. Yelp pointed me to the Hungry Monk. Here now for my fix. The wings were big and meaty with a good mix of legs and wings. I chose hot buffalo and extra hot bbq. It seems they were not tossed in the sauce but rather put on top of it. No big deal really just another excuse to play with my food. I will go back to try other flavors. The restaurant/bar was nice and not too loud but I guess that is to be expected for a Sunday afternoon. They had local craft brews for $3 which was a bonus.
